The waiter came to ask how our food was when one person had already finished and the other almost so.  I told him what was wrong and he offered to replace it, but it was too late.  : /  Sad to have not enjoyed my meal - but the company was GREAT!
Food is fairly average. Nothing special. Slow service. Took almost 30 mins to get our food on what looked like a slow day.

Did the happy hour which is cheap and appetizers was really good specially the avocado with shrimp and crab meat and mangoes delish!!!!!! We also ordered chicken wings with BBQ sauce dip, spinach and chips and shrimp poppers... and my favorite drink was Virgin Bahamaritas (strawberry and kiwi slush yum)
First time here for happy hour and got coconut shrimp and jumbo lump crab stack, soooo good! Definitely coming back for more Mon-Fri 4-6pm

I have been coming here on and off for years.  The menu seems to have changed but the one thing that has absolutely remained the same is their Mojito.  

The Mojito is made from fresh pressed sugar cane and it muddled to perfection.  THe standard comes with a light rum.  After your second or third start to experiment with some of the other rums...perhaps a dark one.

Great restaurant .. Amazing food and happy hour $3 -20oz beers ...Local place , great for your budget Dione our server was one of the best serve that I have had...if you want to eat and drink cheap this is a must ... Don't spend money on the strip go here it's well worth your money and it brings you to the Bahamas

We had a really good experience here for a networking happy hour during a recent conference! We were able to rent their deck space, which was very cute, and had really good service. The food and drinks were good too. Everyone in our group of 40 or so seemed to have a good time!

What a fun restaurant!!

We came here after we prepped all our models for a show and it was a fabulous place to eat.  It was more of a carribean type dining experience!

We asked to be seated outside since we smokers and their deck was still sort of indoors.  But airy enough for us to smoke.  There was live music playing, a bar in the deck area, and another deck for larger reservations/parties.  I was impressed on the decor already.  I'm a sucker for restaurants that are interesting to look at, sometimes I go with not so interesting people to eat. hehehe

Anyhooo...as soon as we sat, we were asked about drinks.  I ordered a mojito, but I should have gotten the Bahama Mama margarita...It looked dramatic as it tasted. DAMMIT!!! But nevertheless, my mojito was still delicious!!!

Apetizers:  Coconut shrimp....HOT AS HELL (temp wise) which meant it was freshly cooked!!! HMMMM to die for....

My plate:  Chicken Kabobs!!!  OH my god it was the best kabobs ever.  Chicken was cooked with red and green bell peppers, whole mushrooms, and red onions.  The kabobs were served over "island rice".  

SO GOOOD!! I toook it home to the hotel and saved it for the next nite!!!
Went here last night & I absolutely enjoyed the food and drinks! Friendly waiter as well

I visited Bahama Breeze with my boyfriend on August 24th. A friend of his recommended the spot to us. Since it was off the Vegas strip we were seated right away. Our waitress was Jaime. She was very attentive and polite. She had asked us if we had been there before so she could properly introduce us to the menu and even made a few suggestions. I ordered coffee and mentioned I was tired and Jaime frequently stopped by to check if I needed more coffee. 
I ordered their fish tacos with fries. I really enjoyed their spread for the tacos it had a nice zing to it. The entree came with 3 tacos so it is a large serving. My boyfriend order the chicken and mashed sweet potatoes. YUM!
The restaurant is huge. Tall ceilings and lots of sectioned off seating areas with different decor, which made it visually appealing. There was lots of seating in the hostess area as well. I thought the wooden beach chairs were a nice touch.
I would definitely return to this establishment.

Items selected:

- Key West Fish Tacos
- Island Hopper: Jamaican chicken wings, conch fritters, coconut shrimps, onion rings

While the food quality met our minimum expectation, cleanliness fell short. Our server was throwing her towel to the table and sprayed the cleanser from a distance, the vaporized mist almost got to my table... The floor and the seat was not clean either.

And no wonder, they got shut down by the SNHD right after our visit.

http://vegas.eater.com/2014/9/5/6159951/bahama-breeze-suffers-an-imminent-health-hazard

Gross.

Another great meal at Bahama Breeze!  Stopped in with my family to have lunch and as usual, everything was just Great!  Nachos on point, Margaritas Amazing, Seafood Chowder hit the spot, and the Steak was great, love the sauce!  The service is always good there, and I love the decor!

Super disappointed with our experience here. When we were sat down we waited for a long time to for the waiter to come to our table. When he did show up we ordered 2 sodas but never received any water. The sodas took forever as well and when we finally got them they were watered down and Flat. We ordered an appetizer and when they brought it to the table they just dropped it off without even paying attention we didn't have any silverware or plates. More waiting finally I just got up and got silverware from another table and went hunting for a waiter to bring plates so we could eat our food. By that time I was over the entire experience and just wanted to eat and go home.

I think Olive Garden could have made a better fish taco. One ounce of cold white fish tucked into a stale flour tortilla with some cabbage. Nope! The second star is for the tortilla soup I got before the tacos, that was pretty delish. Normally I try to give a place the benefit of the doubt but my dining mates described their dishes as "this doesn't do rice a roni justice" and "seems like boiled salad." Sorry Bahama Breeze, step it up!
Good food, Good service, Great environment and Fair Prices. Last minute reservation and they were still able to get us a table for our party of 11.
This place reminded me of Yard House.  Similar food items.  We had the wings, beef empanadas, shrimp quesadilla, and the ahi.  The ahi was the most tasty thing.

even thou BB is a chain eatery  really like the food. i try to visit when in LV and really enjoy the food and service. all the appetizers are very good and if visit during HH are worth the money for sure. plenty of beer, wine etc buy i like the Bahamarita. 1 more tip........ ask for CHRISTINE  to be ur server. she has served us several times and is always friendly, helpful and a JOY to be around while in LV and the BB.

I came to this restaurant during a family reunion.  I knew that we were a large group and I knew that it may take a bit longer but the time that it took for my drinks and my food to arrive was just ridiculous and we were the last table to be served when we were the first to have our order taken.  This is not the kind of service that I would wish for anyone and there would be no recommendation give to anyone ever

It's so lovely here!!!! The inside is beautiful. Came here for the first time with a friend on Cinco De Mayo and I will say it felt very tropical here. We got there during happy hour so all appetizers were half off and the regular margaritas were $5. Everything was delicious. We ordered the nachos and the jerk chicken wings. Everything was enjoyable and had much flavor. 
The bad news was as we were paying for our check, the couple in the booth behind us frantically got up stating there was a huge flying roach on the window seal. I didn't stay long enough to see it. My friend and I both got up and paid our check in the front of the restaurant.
Looking for a light lunch and found the lobster shrimp quesidilla on the appetizer menu. Tasty!
Best food since we have been in Vegas. Family friendly, affordable.  Very friendly service.   The coconut shrimp was to die for.   The coconut shrimp tacos blew my mind.

Came here for lunch on Sunday & Monday (2/13 & 2/14)

I absolutely love this place.

I think I love the service more than ever. They have the best friendliest staff ever! (I know I sounded like a little kid over exaggerating) But, honest to God. You cannot find that type of service in LA.

This is like my favorite lunch spot in Vegas.

The plates are a hit and miss. Depends on what you order and if you know what you're ordering. 

Good luck and enjoy the good food. Cause there sure aren't any in LA.

*Get the cilantro cream sauce for dipping its grrrrrrrrrrrrreat!*

I've always loved Bahama Breeze and this location is no exception.  The coconut shrimp and seafood chowder soup is my favorite.  The fish tacos looked awesome and is on my list for next time.  The service was friendly and quick too.  Love the tropical drinks especially the painkiller and coconut mojito.

I've come to this restaurant several times and have always received very good service and food in a good environment. My last visit was on a Wednesday night at about 930-10pm. We were greeted and seated well. 

Then came the most flamboyant black male waiter ever. For some reason he completely lost it when I inquired about the chicken quesadilla. He told me they weren't that good and I still decided to try them. He then, while rolling his eyes, said," so you're going to try something and then send it back if you don't like it, AFTER I just told you it's not that good?" I replied,"yes!" 

So the food was bought to the table and the food was freshly cook, and quesadilla was good. There were two male waiters that for some reason were extra loud and at times inappropriate. For example this waiter at my table continued to make it obvious that he was addressing my girlfriend alone, right from the moment he first approached the table. 

At some point, I'll return to the restaurant but they lost points with me. We were having a great night and this experience with the waiter messed the vibe up, completely.

My Island oasis in the middle of Sin City.  We come here every time we come to Vegas.  I know you have no clue who "we" are.... but my whole family.  We plan where we are going to stay, club and when we are going to eat at Bahama Breeze.

Let's start with the Cons.... there isn't a location in Southern California.  Then again, id probably spend my rent money eating there all the time.  

The Service: Is always wonderful. Haven't had a bad experience yet.  The staff is always helpful and pleasant.  So cheers to them!

The Atmosphere: Wonderful!  For someone who has been to the "islands" this place is a good representation.  From the ceiling fans to the music being played.  Not loud, but mellow music.  Helps the food go down better... screw the sugar.

The Food:  OMG! Even if everything else was horrible the Food is so good you'd ignore it.

Jerk Chicken- my mouth is watering just thinking of them.  They have the perfect amount of jerk flavoring and are fried or baked to perfection.  Crispy on the outside but tender and juicy on the inside.  We made a mistake of sharing an order. Bad idea.  These are too good to share.

Beef Patties- Yummy! If flavor and good food aren't you thing... steer clear of this option. Truly a mouth satisfying appetizer.

Seafood Paella-So I have had Paella at a number of locations and this is one of the best.  The whole dish is a burst of happiness in your mouth.  I've had this 2 of the last 3 times I went here.  Everything else just doesn't seem to catch my eye.....

Always too full for dessert..... maybe next time.

This place rocks! The service is fast, the food is delicious ~ try the jerk wings :)
The drinks are tasty.. we have never had bad service or meal coming here. The atmosphere is awesome!
Haven't been here for years. Don't know why we've waited so long to come back. Great menu and great atmosphere. Prompt and friendly service. Outdoor seating with this weather is perfect.
The place is HUGE inside!!!  The food was really good... the firecracker shrimp were my favorite for the night... only downfall, the service was just a little slow!

I'm a Caribbean girl that cannot get enough of sweet Bahama Breeze. I always make an extra effort, to dine in here when I visit Vegas. Another 5 Star visit on a warm Saturday night. I made a reservation a couple days ahead, for myself and a few of my girlfriends. I was just a little disappointed that they didn't have the Reggae band playing. 

Overall the service was outstanding. Our waiter was very attentive & efficient. 
Now to the delicious food.
Here's what we opted for:
Taste of Jamaica - 
Awesome jerk pork, jerk chicken, beef empanada, callaloo, sweet plantains, white rice and black beans. Respek the flavor. Love, loved it. 
My very favorite is the Lobster & Shrimp quesadillas. This is a must try. There's no other like it. Two thumbs up!
Caribbean style lobster Mac&Cheese - 
Lightly fried lobster tail with Bahamian mac & cheese. AMAZING! 

Drinks
Goombay Smash - very strong but good. 
Yaka Hula - Bacardi Black Rum, pineapple juice for a tropical tribute to Island romance. This sweet cocktail was inspired by a Hawaiian love song. Excellent drink. One of my favorites.
Pineapple Coconut martini- This is one Sexy drink. Loved it.

My fellow yelpers, I would not steer you wrong, if you're tired of buffet food, fancy expensive hotel dining, come to Bahama Breeze. Prices are very reasonable. Trust me, you won't be disappointed. I will always be a returning customer.

Although I've only been to Bahama Breeze in Las Vegas once, I've been plenty of times in Jacksonville Florida when I used to live there, even celebrated my birthday there. So I think due time for a review.

This restaurant is actually one of my favorite places to dine; it's not "fine" dining, but it's not cheap casual. It's a nice in between kinda place, affordable but definitely appropriate for special occasions 

They have awesome fruity speciality drinks but also a full bar so your dark liquors as well and standard type drinks. They have HH from 9pm-close Sunday thru Thursday which is great for Vegas! Love reserve HH!! And their HH includes food items as well. 

This BB is way bigger here in Vegas than the one in Jacksonville. Bigger restaurant means bigger decor and displays inside. Pretty standard dim lighting and Caribbean decor. We came on a Friday and surprisingly it was not busy at all. They had a small dj at the outside patio playing hip hop music that did not seem to fit the theme for the restaurant but the inside music was more fitting and appropriate to the island theme. 

They have a wide variety menu all incorporating an island type theme and taste, but I love how their menu is separated and really makes selection an easy task. 

I'm a sucker for their establishment favorite the Coconut Shrimp. I think I get it every time as an appetizer! The crispy coconut batter on the butterfly shrimps are fried to perfection and that citrus mustard dipping sauce is almost like a marmalade glaze. Not too sweet tho and that mustard almost like a Dijon flavor gives it a nice kick! Definitely one of my fav dishes here. 

My family was having seafood this night (we refrain from meat on Fridays during Lent) and this place has lots of seafood options, well lots of options period. We had the Key West Shrimp and Grits, Calypso Shrimp Linguine, the Fish Tacos, and the Island Hopper (it comes with jerk chicken but we just saved it to bring home). 

The shrimp and grits was good, but I wish there was more grits that came with the dish. But the garlic light cream sauce on the shrimp was good and not too heavy, just right. The green beans at accompanied the dish were good, just needed a dab on pepper. 

The calypso shrimp linguine was the best tasting of the 4 main dishes we ordered. My sisters dish so I can only comment on that I tried a little bit of it, but it was enough and tasted good enough that when I go back I want that to be my order!! It's like a light pink sorta sauce, white cream sauce but with the Caribbean flavors and spices it turns it sorta pink ish. Every good and sauce was not too heavy at all. 

My dad had fish tacos accompanied by fries and guacamole. The guc was really good but the tacos shells were a bit too hard. 

The island hopper actually is listed as an appetizer, but mom got it as a main entreè.  Comes with coconut shrimp, coconut batter covered onion rings, shrimp stuffed hush puppies and jerk chicken. The onion rings were good and the coconut batter adds a nice twist of flavor. The hush puppies also very good. I like that they were not too dense, and nice a light almost fluffy. The dish also comes with the citrus mustard and a pineapple chutney - which also tasted like a sweet with a kick pineapple marmalade or glaze!! You can eat the chutney straight, it's so yummy. 

Also the bathrooms are big and nice and I like how the have little mouthwash cups and mouthwash available at the sink so if you're going out straight after dinner, that least you good on the breath check 

The place is a chain restaurant, so you get what you expect, but it's great food, reasonable pricing, appropriate for special occasions but not going to blow your wallet like if you were to eat somewhere on strip in Las Vegas and probably get less quantity. It's a good vibes sorta place and the service is good!! S/O to our server Matt for taking good care of us!! 

Solid good dining restaurant and I will be back! Yay
This was an amazing restaurant. The jerk chicken was as close to authentic as you can get. The empanadas were delicious as well. Fun environment. Cute setting. Definitely a great place to eat!

Came here for dinner on Saturday night.  Easy to get a table and the service was perfect, never felt rushed and never waited for a refill or a dirty plate to be taken away.  Food was delicious and the margarita was the best I have had in quite awhile.

The first time I went here I thought it was amazing. The second time not so much, it could be due to the fact that my mom was vomiting in her napkin(alcoholic) and it just killed it. It just didn't seem to deliver like i remembered. Not sure I'll be back.

This is now one of my favorite places to eat in vegas.. I have eaten here dozens of times.  They have amazing drinks, and their food is like none other.  Unique, flavorful and just WOW. We have eaten at various times of day, and have always had A+ service and food. You MUST go there.. Love their Bahama Magarite with a sweet shot on the side.  The bread pudding was so good and love their specials..
I always get the Caribbean jerk chicken pasta.  I love it ! YUM
My favorite place to eat and drink .Been there a few time and never had a bad experience bar tenders and waiters are very friendly.and the drinks are amazing!

Service was great, food was great and not very expensive, atmosphere was very nice. The only downside was the drinks were a little pricey which considering its Vegas, probably very common. We came on a Friday night at 630pm and had no wait. Definitely worth coming
My favorite happy hour in Las Vegas. Half off appetizers and $4 cocktails. The Ultimate Pina Coloda is my fave its so refreshing. The jerk chicken wings are a must try.

If you wanna feel like you're on vacation come here! Tropical drinks, amazing food, & atmosphere that makes you think you're eating on an island. I'd recommend to everyone! This place is huge & the layout is awesome. Also good service.

What's not to love about this place?! We got a tip while around town that if you want to try an amazing pina colada, go to Bahama Breeze. We went over obviously with high expectations and we were not let down whatsoever. 

I would like to mention that the service here is phenomenal. Our waitress, Tina, was probably one of the nicest waitresses I have had in along time. She was personable, she would talk and joke with us and just super nice. I have no complaints about service at all. 

The atmosphere in this place is pretty rad as well. There was live music, a little covered deck with a fire pit, and a lot of cool decorations that made for a great environment. This place is mainly a seafood restaurant, so if that's not your thing then this place probably isn't for you. I'm a huge seafood fan so I loved it. 

Last of all, the sought after pina colada that we were searching town for were hands down the best I've ever had! There was more to it than just your average pina colada, it was called the "ultimate pina colada" for a reason. Me and my girlfriend both were very impressed with it. We weren't too hungry so we just got some street tacos to shared and they were great as well.

We sat and hung out at this place and just talked for a while because it was such a great environment to just relax and have a great time. 
If you're in Vegas,  GO TO THE BAHAMA BREEZE! You will not be disappointed.

Love the jerk chicken pasta and fresh lemonade!!! That's a must have with any meal. Food is always good and customer service is great! Always a nice treat for the family, especially when you have small kids since it's kid friendly. Always nice to have dinner in the outdoor patio area. Oh and make sure you attend happy hour!!!! Yummy!!!! Definitely a favorite spot.

We decided to avoid the craziness of the strip & come here for dinner last night, thinking it would be less busy. It was a lot less busy but very understaffed. We had to wait almost 40 min for a table for 4 at an almost empty restaurant. We were seated at around 10:30 pm. 

To be fair - the food was not bad. What was most upsetting is that I ordered the rice bowl with shrimp & fish. A few bites in, I bit into something hard. I thought it was a fish bone but it was a sharp jagged piece of a plastic - probably the remnants of a food container about an inch long and wide. I told the server & she asked if I wanted my dish replaced and I said no as I did not want to wait for another plate at that time of night as our kids were very tired. She showed the plastic object to her manager & I was waiting to see what he/she would say or do. Well the disappointing outcome is they did nothing. No apology from the manager & we got charged for my dish. Very disappointing.  

This is not the first time we have found unwelcome objects in our food at restaurants. In fact once at BJ's my sons Mac & Cheese had the corner of a plastic bag in it but we did not say anything as it was large enough to see & not harmful. The sever saw it as she collected the plates & reported it to the manager. She came to our table to apologize & said we would not be charged for the dish. 

So to the manager of the Bahama Breeze - your management skills need some fine tuning to say the least. Your food quality control obviously needs some work. It's not OK to find sharp plastic objects in our food & it's especially not OK for you to ignore it. Very disappointing.

The extra star is for our excellent service-
To be honest the food was "alright". 
Alexis was very personable and informative. I was so pleased to have observed her equally attentive and welcoming service to all customers. My husband and I often go out and its rare and rewarding to get great service. Thank you.

Great layout, music, etc; relaxing atmosphere. 

I was in Vegas for a work convention (exciting, I know) and on the way to the airport, for the last couple of hours, I wanted something quick and easy... but relaxing.  My local friends wanted to meet here for Happy Hour.  

I got here around 4:30 on a Monday.  I really love being able to just park and walk up in Vegas. Eating on the strip is a whole process of parking and walking through casinos... that's like a wasted 20 minutes there, another 20 back.  A place like this, nice and easy.  

The layout is great.  It goes for a Caribbean/Cuban feel, especially outside, without feeling cheesy.  Nice shutters on the enclosed patio area, warm air coming in, sunny... just a very relaxed atmosphere where you really don't feel like you're in Vegas.  I felt like I was on vacation, actually, which sounds cheesy but it's true.  The restaurant was pretty open, though, but it was a weekday.  

Now, the food...

Happy Hour is an amazing deal.  It's like $5-something per dish and beers and drinks are from $2-$3....!?  What... the... hell!  So good.   

We were starving so we got almost one of everything; the jerk chicken, pork sliders, burger sliders, empandas, quesadilla, coconut shrimp, etc.  Everything was great.  My friends were a little hesitant about the jerk chicken because it was black, due to the rub, but it was great.   My friends had a pineapple coconut martini (great), mojito (they loved it, had real sugar cane), I had a hefeweizen.   

So basically, you can't miss at Happy Hour - everything was great.

This is a small detail that I really appreciate. In the men's bathroom, they have mouthwash dispensers. It's a great touch because, let's be honest, your breath after eating isn't going to be the best so this is a great way to hit the reset button. 

It was just a fun, casual experience... it really felt like we weren't in Vegas, but on vacation.

Delicious shrimp and Mahi, vegetables,sweet peas and yellow rice- combined in one perfect mix, just the right Jamaican spices! Delicious mojitos and exotic island drinks make for a perfect touch with sesame crusted Ahi tuna!! the Jerk chicken is scrumptious.  The Lobster and shrimp quesadilla should not be missed- enjoy the island music, the superb service and the island ambience!! Special thank you to Brandon and Dan for making our dinner extra special. Happy hour is great and the fire pit always adds to the perfect island setting.

Went on a Sunday for lunch and it was pretty good. Had the sirloin and it was fine. Had the ultimate pineapple drink and it was on point. Service was good and restaurant seemed to have a pretty laid back atmosphere. All the food we ordered was pretty good, would recommend to others and go back.

Great place. We've been here before. As we arrived and were seated we spent about 5 minutes without a greeting or drinks. I was a little upset but the manager took notice and made everything great. She took care of us immediately. Offered 2 appetizers on the house and turned us over to a great server. The rest of the meal was perfect. The Mahi Mahi was cooked as it should. Environment is lively and inviting. Great dinner. Thank you
#JerkWings..#HappyHour..Great food and service was on point as well..Must stop by if you are staying in the area.

Happy hours prices are VERY good, but sit at the bar.  I don't know if my waiter was new or what but service was very slow.  Never came by to check if we needed more drinks.  Only stayed for one round and appetizers.  Food was pretty bland but cheap.  Probably won't be back.

If you like piña coladas and getting caught in the rain, this is your spot especially during happy hour!! My friend took me here since we both were craving for refreshing piña coladas. Happy hour deals are great. We came in at 5 and the restaurant wasn't so busy so we got seated right away. Our waitress took our orders and was very enthusiastic. The only thing was that she didn't commit to her promises. When she asked if we wanted lemon with our water, she did not provide the lemon. And many times she visited our table of empty cups, she did not quickly respond to refill them. Other than that, food and drinks were bomb and I also really like the set up of the restaurant. It's nicely jungle/exotic themed and they also offer patio seating for lovely fresh air! Will be back for more

This place is a total joke. Our server was an absolute jerk who refused to give us menus because we sat down in the bar table area without getting menus from the dimwitted hostess. Then he went off on a tangent about how there was a miscommunication and we should not have been seated without menus. He is the definition of a low wage uneducated worker. So then i go to the bar and tell the bartender i want two drinks for me and my date (who looked better in her photos ) and he says he will let our server know because im in his section. I go off on the dude because i just want to get two drinks and carry them the 2 feet from the bar to the table right behind me, but he refused to do this cause it wasn't fair to the server. What a bunch of degenerates at this chain hell. The manager came over and eventually offered to buy me 2 drinks, but hell no because he defended his erver. Ended up walking out on my ugly date, who was sitting at the table wondering what the hell she should do and also this Bahama Breeze forever. Letter to corporate also sent, but a canned response was received. Punks.

We went here for dinner on 8.12.15 and had a great experience. Our server Tina and her team were very attentive and the food was delicious. Happy hour is good because you don't have to be just in the bar to take advantage of the reduced rate. We have been here several times when visiting Vegas, I wish the restaurant was close to home in California.

We came into here, while in Vegas, off of the YELP reviews!  The inside is very cute and tropical. I had a frozen specialty drink and it was delicious.  My husband got ice tea and it was horrible.  So, they brought a fresh brewed glass of tea, and it tasted bad too!   It tasted like old coffee.  We thought maybe they brew the coffee and tea in the same pitcher. But he assured us that doesn't happen.  We left and did not order food. We figured if they can't do something as simple as tea, that there could be more disappointments!

This is now the 3rd time we have been here and they have again failed to disappointment. First of, our waitress was wonderful. Her name is Tina. She was wonderful and friendly. She took her time to explain each item to us. When we did not like a particular drink, she immediately changed it for us. What wonderful service!

We have been to Bahama Breeze twice so far. I would have to say their seafood is way better than their steaks. The drinks are reasonably priced and the staff are always friendly. Going there reminds me of visiting the bahamas.  Overall, we really enjoy this place and would definitely recommend it.

Ugh, so many people that I know like this place, but I don't get it!  I've been here a handful of times because it is right around the corner from my office.

Located on the corner of Flamingo & Paradise, there is indoor and outdoor seating and a decent amount of parking.

I came here last week for lunch with 5 of my co-workers.  They ask where we would like to sit.  We asked if we could sit in the "patio" area; its this big round room and the windows can open when it's nice outside.  So they take us to the table; there are only 3 seats.  We look at the guy that brought us to our table and we say "this table is a little too small, there are 5 of us" and he says "yes, I know.  I have no idea why they brought you out here.  Unfortunately, there isn't any tables out here big enough for your group."  We tell him no problem and sit us wherever there is room.

He takes us back inside to the room behind the bar and sits us at a table that is set for 4 people, but enough room for 5.

We ordered a handful of appetizers and each of us ordered entrees.  I ordered the combination chicken & veggie quesadilla and a caesar salad.  The caesar was barely dressed and wasn't that good anyways.  Now, I've had the lobster quesadilla here before and it was gross.  So I thought chicken and fresh vegetables couldn't be that bad.  Well, it's not good.  I don't know how to put it.  But the flavor sucks.

We get a discount to eat here because of where our office is located and I would STILL never come here again.

Went here for a birthday party! Kristine B And Kurt did an amazing service! The food was great. I ordered a burger and fries and it was so good. My boyfriend had a pasta that was just as good.
Nice atmosphere and very clean.

First time here around 1 pm on a saturday. When we walked in we were told a 15 min wait although there were a ton of empty tables. When I asked why the wait the hostess said each server could only have 3 tables. Maybe management should learn how to staff. The food sounds great on paper but none had any flavor it was very bland. The service was ok I wouldn't rush to eat here

Not so great the only thing good i had was the drinks. Jerk chicken -dry, coconut shrimp was ok- sauce was nasty, and the dip for the chips were nasty..... Will I return hell- no
EVERYTHING left on the table not really touch but empty drink glasses
Had a business mixer here and loved the staff and atmosphere. The waitress always made sure I had a drink and never went without. Will definitely return!

The food tastes like a cross between something out of a can, low end buffet food, and frozen mass produced microwaved dish components. 

I had the grilled chicken with cilantro sauce. It was slop. Nothing tasted fresh. The sauces were definitely from a gallon can or barrel. 

I've had a salad here my previous time which was edible but not great, hence the 2 stars and not 1star. 

Also, prices are very cheap for the area, and many office workers from walking distance go since there is a discount for Howard Hughes buildings employees. 

For the money I'd rather drive or walk a few blocks more and get something I'm going to enjoy.

I've never tried Caribbean inspired food before so when my friend took us here, I was in for a pleasant surprise. Upon entering the restaurant, I loved the décor and the ambiance in general. They had live music the night that we went, which added to our wonderful experience here. Our waitress was such a sweet heart and she gave us some very good meal suggestions. The food was delicious! I highly recommend, especially if you've never had any Caribbean style food before.
Awesome place located on paradise awesome drink a must to visit.  The food is very good to, parking is ok.

What is not to love about this place, we usually come in for the happy hour deal, my favorite are ultimate piña colada, shrimp with lobster quesadillas, jumbo lump crab stack, Jamaican chicken wings and sesame crusted ahi, the price is so reasonable and they are very generous with their portion. Theirs waiters and waitresses are always upbeat and happy.

A new favorite!  We were looking for a casual seafood restaurant not on the strip.  Very happy we found Bahama Breeze and will definitely be back.  Our only complaint is there are no BB in Arizona where we live!   I had a salmon tostado. Delicious with lots of greens on the tostado, topped with the salmon.  DH had fish tacos which he liked very much.  It was just before Mothers' Day and I had their special Mothers' Day cocktail. What a trip. They put Cotton Candy (yes) in a martini glass, and dropped some raspberries on it. Then, at our table, they shook together rum and fruit flavored liquors and poured them over the cotton candy (which melted)  It was very sweet and really fun to have.  Service was very helpful and friendly and time waiting for food was fine.

Love the food and the service.  We had the grilled Mahi Mahi with mash potatoes. Also I ordered the lemongrass shrimp and Mahi Mahi, it was a big portion. I recommend the half size portion of your not very hungry. The Night Shift Manager MoMe is the BEST. Also the bartender Jason is also one of the best.

LOVE IT!

The atmosphere, food & staff have been great so far!

We came here for my daughters birthday dinner & she loved the atmosphere. She loves water fountains & water falls so she loved seeing a wishing fall right when you enter. 

Our food was amazing, I ordered the Stuffed Plantain and it was so good. All of their plates are pretty large, great for sharing or just taking the rest home. Our kiddos ordered the kids Mac n' Cheese and it was pretty good, they ate it all. Once again the plates are pretty big so our kiddos shared that plate and it was more than enough for them. My husband ordered the Skirt Steak Churrasco & enjoyed it, he as well ordered a Coconut Mojito which was fresh with a hint of sweetness. I ordered their Mango Lemonade for myself and the kiddos and we loved it. A little on the sweeter side but it comes chilled so it tastes good, I'm not big on sweet drinks but this was pretty good. 

We plan on going back for sure.

Just perfect after a cross country flight.  Chicken scirache sandwich and a stone ipa it doesn't get any better.  Fish taco and a top shelf margarita, again perfect.  All for 40 bucks, pretty good for Vegas.
Best service! My sister and her husband had her wedding here! Food was great and they even gave extra! Drinks are excellent too! I love this place!

The food was absolutely fabulous. I had the jerk chicken pasta and it was great. My husband had the beef bowl and he was beyond pleased. The key lime pie was amazing. Great family atmosphere. The children's menu was healthy and delicious. We had dinner there 2 nights in a row because it was soooo good. Both nights our waitresses were wonderful. Tina and Marge were wonderful, welcoming people. Can't wait to go back. I'm sorry you don't have a location in California. Thanks again

I've eaten at this restaurant a couple of times and there food is pretty good overall. I like the theme of the place...makes me feel like I'm on a tropical island. I absolutely love their bathrooms...I feel bathrooms say a lot about a restaurant. They were very clean, nicely decorated, full size doors for every stall, big size stalls, and they have mouth wash with individual cups so you can be minty fresh as you leave.

The food:

Lobster and Shrimp Quesadilla- It was good but I imagined something different so it was tasty but I felt it was missing a bit more flavor. Glad I tried it but I'll probably go with something else next time.

Seafood Chowder- That was delicious, had a good amount of shrimp and vegetables and was creamy, I loved it.

Cobb Salad- It was big and came with the usual fixings but I've had better cobb's in my life. 

Coconut Shrimp- Mmm...mmm...mmm...a must if you eat at this restaurant. Perfectly fried and packed with flavor.

Chocolate Pineapple Cake- I don't like chocolate but I do love pineapple and this dessert called to me. It was warm, rich, and melted in my mouth. I suggest sharing because it's very decadent...I needed a glass of water when I finished. 

They have a large menu so there's something for everyone and they have a good selection of tropical alcoholic drinks.
I recently ate at Bahama Breeze in Las Vegas.  The food and service were great.   The prices were very reasonable.   The Shrimp Tacos were awesome. Give them a try.  You won't be disappointed.

The food here is great...I loved almost everything we ordered.  Especially good was the jerk Jamaican chicken...annoying to eat the wings but the spices made it worth the bother.  Their seafood Paella is very yummy.  Drinks are pretty strong...especially the mojito.  If you want something sweeter, try their coconut pineapple martini.  For appetizers, I liked the coconut shrimp, calamari, and spinach artichoke dip.

Their bathrooms are really nice too.  They have nice smelling lotion and mouthwash.  Service is pretty good.  There is a large patio which is very convenient if you have a big party.

The food was about an 8 out of 10 to me. The bar server that served us was not attentive at all (and she was not busy. Lot of times just talking to co-workers..with her back to us the majority of the time). Therefore, her tip was very minimal.

Take a trip to the Carribean and enjoy coconut shrimp with a Bahama Mama drink; clean atmosphere, friendly staff, relax with Reggae sounds and marimba music. The menu is simple and reasonably priced. Sit outside and chill and meet new people.

Excellent food and service. The place is huge though and the noise a bit to loud for my taste.

We were quickly seated and served by Donna, which was such a nice girl! Very observant all the way!

Had a mojito which was delicious - not many people can make a great mojito, I think.

Had the shrimp linguine which was delicious too.

My dad had the lobster linguine which I tasted and it sadly enough did not taste of that much.

Ended the meal with a dulce de leche cheese cake which was soooo delicious and so sinful to eat as it contains about 900cal according to the menu card. 

I also had a margarita with my dulce de leche cake, which I will not recommend unless you really like tequila as it is really dominating in the drink. 

I am sad that the place was so big and loud as the food and the service was excellent.

My wife and I just stopped by this place and we checked the reviews on Yelp and we came for lunch. We definitely enjoyed this place. It is a mixed of Caribbean food. Really good. In addition my wife order a pinacolada. She loved it. It has a little splash of run. If you don't like too much alcohol this is for you otherwise you can order something different. I ordered a margarita mango. This one, I really don't recommend it. Not a good taste. I couldn't found the taste of the mango. It was more alcohol than anything else. Next time I may tried something else. Very affordable and great food.

A little Caribbean in the desert. This is one of my favorite restaurants since I moved to Vegas. The restaurant has a relaxing feel and good music. They have a great selection of tropical drinks. I love the food and have probably ordered everything on the menu. My last visit I had the smothered pork chop lunch special and it was delicious!

Where do I start?  This was our first stop (AFTER HOTEL) to eat and drink.  The food was pretty good.  My husband was impressed by the jerk chicken.  We devoured our food!!!!!  The drinks were good and CHEAP.  The staff helped our group of 25 people (many of them under 25) without issue.

Just as good as the Bahama breeze I remembered in Orlando.  Food was great as was the cocktails!  We got in during happy hour which meant $5 cocktails and 1/2 priced appetizers.  Their Pina cola da is  an island twist off the norm with strawberry swirled throughout, so yummy.  Their habanero wings were great with a sweet and spicy sauce which only left a slight tingle on the tongue but still packed with flavor.  We also enjoyed the jerk shrimp appetizer which was shrimp scampi bathing in a pond of buttery broth with very subtle jerk seasoning, not overpowering like I had anticipated, and served with a French bread loaf for soaking up the flavorful broth.  My entree was their special: A lobster, shrimp, and mussel bowl with baby potatoes and butternut squash, swimming in a tomato herb soup also served with French bread for dipping.  Slightly different seasoning compared to the Italian or cuban versions I've had before, with similar seasoning as their jerk shrimp, but not overpowering.  Overall the food was great and the service started out good, but at the end we sat waiting for our server and bill, so a little let down there, but otherwise a real treat!
Great atmosphere and food  awsome selection of cocktails.  Daniel is an awsome server
The lunch specials are great for a great price. I would not recommend sitting in the outside "covered" area because it has poor ventilation and it always hot and muggy. Other than that, great

I was pleasantly surprised!  Honestly wasn't expecting much, but my chicken tortilla soup was really good.  Very flavourful and featuring a lovely broth.  My server, Victor, was delightfully snarky whilst demonstrating waiterly competence.  My lunch companions were equally happy with their meals and we all wished we could stay longer to enjoy the island ambience.

My husband and I usually go here with his parents for the holidays or special occassions. His Grandma always sends a gift card to this restaurant. I'm guessing it's one of her favorites. On this occassion I had the ahi salad appetizer and an iced tea. 

I saw ahi on the menu and I knew I had to have it. I've been on a real tuna kick lately and the menu pic looked divine. When I received my plate... after a very long wait it looked exactly like the menu. It was stunning. 

Sadly it didn't taste like they seared the tuna in sesame oil, so there wasn't a ton of flavor. Also it was an appetizer and not an entree. I knew this going in, but there was no entree sized ahi, and I wanted ahi bad. I ate it and I was still hungry. I resorted to stealing french fries off my husband's plate when he wasn't looking. 

The decor was beautiful and there is even a fun little waterfall and river running through the restraunt. I had lots of time to walk around and snap photos because the service was exceptionally slow. The iced tea tasted fresh brewed and was quite good. Despite slow service, my glass was usually full so I was grateful for that. 

So the bottom line... It was ok. I will be back. I wish they had a full size ahi salad, and I wish they used sesame oil to sear and maybe a touch of wasabi on the side just for fun. I've had better tasting dishes here that were more filling, so maybe next time I'll grab the entree portion of the shrimp instead.

My fiance and I went on a double date here tonight. We have never been to this restaurant before but heard their late night happy hour was nice. We got there just after 9 and it was fairly empty. I requested to sit outside because it was 80 outside but felt nice. We were seated in the "outside" with an AC unit blasting on us. I get cool easily so I wasn't loving it. We ordered 2 Pina Coladas, nachos, a burger and side Salad.  The drinks were good, good flavor but took a while to come. The food was out so quickly it was amazing. The burger was decent, as my fiance said it's hard to mess up a burger. The ceaser salad was, meh, limp lettuce and way to much dressing. The nachos were disappointing. Not enough chip to topping ratio, the salsa was a little bit meh too. Overall we didn't spend much because of the happy hour and we left full. We decided we wouldn't be back unless it was just for drinks because the food wasn't that great.

Yum yum yum...

The lobster mac is EVERYTHING.  The drinks were measured and everyone knows thats not my thing...but still worth it.  The bartender told me that happy hour started again from 9pm to 12 am, so as a visitor I really appreciated the great service.

I also met a great new friend here...so what more can I ask for!

4 stars because it feels like a chain and again drinks are measured.
This place is incredible, the service, the food, the drinks, the atmosphere. I highly recommend this place for anyone. We will definitely be back!!

That chicken tortilla soup is absolutely delicious.  Could be I am a sucker for fresh chunks of avocado.  No, the soup would have even been delicious without it.

The rest of the meal was fine, and filling.  The drinks were reasonably priced.  The restaurant itself is nice... pretty decor.  Nice amenities in the ladies' room, I love the scope with little disposable cups.  Our server did his job adequately.

Overall, nothing to complain about, but nothing outstanding aside from that yummy soup.

In general I'm not a fan of chains but this place does it right and I've had some fun times here.  They make some really nice drinks and the food is decent.  Some of the food items aren't all that great with a few being grossly bland while others approach greatness.  The drinks generally outshine the food and are among the prettiest and most colorful concoctions I've ever seen while often being a bit too weak on the booze for my palette.  This is a pretty large restaurant that always seems to have a crowd and I really prefer sitting at the bar to be closer to the action so I don't get lost in the horde of other customers.  This isn't a place I would hang out all the time but it certainly can be fun on occasion for a little imaginary tropical flavor.

I've been here a few times.  It's a convenient place for lunch.  I think what this place does well is drinks, desserts, and service.  The mojitos tend to be a little sweet for me but they get the job done.  The banana bread dessert was amazing the last time I had it, as was the pineapple upside down cake.  And the servers have always been fun and friendly.  Oh, and free wi-fi.  Gotta love that!

The entrees need some work though.  They all tend to be really greasy.  I did not see one pasta without cream sauce, except on the kids menu.  You can make some ok food here if you are creative, but it'll take you about 5 minutes to order with all the special requests.  My favorite is probably the chicken kabob with steamed broccoli instead of rice.  Yes, even the rice was too greasy for me.  But the servers have always been willing to put in special requests and get the meal just the way I want it.  The problem is that it has taken a lot of experimentation to get there.  They used to have a lemongrass chicken sandwich that was decent but they took it off the menu. Oh well, I can always just stick to a liquid diet.  :)

I just don't get what people see in this place. I guess the food is just bland enough to appeal to the masses, and it's just cheesy enough to be "fun" (read Tchotchke's in Office Space). From the music, to the decor, to the food, this place is just packed with epic fail. I wanted to shoe the bargain basement Jimmy Buffet square in the nuts, not that I enjoy the real one by any stretch of the imagination.

We had the calamari appetizer, thinking it was a safe bet, and it was astonishingly rubbery. I mean, there's rubbery calamari, then there's this; it's like the difference between vulcanized rubber and the stuff they use in rubber bands. I ordered the seafood paella, and the waiter remarked that it was his favorite dish and it was just fantastic. The guy's nuts. There couldn't have been more wrong with it, save for the fish showing up raw (it was overcooked instead). Absolutely no flavor. They must not put any salt in the pot when they cook the rice, because I don't think there's any other way to make rice this unexciting. I suspect the origin of its yellow-orange hue didn't come from saffron, either. Don't remember what my fiance ordered, and neither does she, but we both remember it sucked. Bland, unexciting, chain-wide recipes aside, this kitchen had some serious issues seasoning their food properly.

All that, a beer, and a margarita for $53. What a gyp.

Service 5/5
Food 4/5
Cleanliness 5/5
Decor 5/5

Came here today and was pretty impressed by the waiter and the wide selection from their menu.  My favorites are the bahamarita, conch fritters, and lobster Shrimp quesadilla. Definitely a repeat!

When in Vegas I love eating off of the strip. Just to get away from all the chaos of the strip.  Walking into this place not only are you away from the strip, but its like walking onto a small island. And u can smell the great aromas as soon as you walk in the door. Now i;m not a big fan of spicy food, but I enjoy some good flavor. Those jamaican jerk chicken wings are phenominal. Its the right amount of heat with the the best amount of absolute great flavor. They were amazingly good. The chicken tortilla soup was just as good. I can't wait to go back and try something else when I have a bigger appetite.
We had Isha as our server and she was awesome! Great customer service and awesome food! I would definitely recommend this place ecsepcially for happy hour!

We came in for lunch today (Thursday) and the service was slow and horrible! Our server (Alejandra)literally dropped off our food and never came back until she dropped off the bill!!  The table next to us had the same issue! 2 Stars because the food and atmosphere was good)
Was here for dinner, onion rings were good but huge so were the conch fritters. Our waiter Brandon was funny and helpful with suggestions. Love Bahamas Breeze!

I came in for lunch today. Service was exceptional. The pasta dish was delicious.
Will definitely be going back. Will probably visit after work for Happy Hour to enjoy the libations.

I had dinner at a Bahama Breeze years ago in Orlando Florida- great experience and good food.  So while visiting LV, I learned there was a location there and had to go! HUGE mistake! It started with a very nice waitress who came to my table... it started like this,
 
'Today's specials are A, B, C, and D. We are out of A and B, and if you want C, we no longer have chorizo that goes in it but we can substitute it for something else.'

Um what??! 

So we asked her for her suggestions and her 'most recommended' items were the Lobster Linguine and the Key West Shrimp and Grits. My husband and I ordered both dishes. Disgusting. You know what this reminded me of? It reminded me of something premade that comes in a bag and thrown in boiling water to heat up.

Really disappointed. We had just wasted money on food that tasted nasty and we were walking out hungry. Never, ever, again. Visited this location June 2014.

Such a fabulous happy hour deal!

The bahamarita was super delicious. Order it if you like tropical goodness, margarita style. If you like coconut..like the malibu rum coconut, you would love the Pineapple Coconut Margarita. Not my cup of tea, but could be yours! I wouldn't recommend the Mojito Cubano unless you're looking for an average glass of mojito. 

Recommendations off appetizers:
Coconut shrimp- Perfect balance of shrimp and batter. Flavor was on point as well. 
Crispy onion rings- JUMBO sized onion rings
Jumbo Lump Crab Cake- Crab can taste a little like the sea, but the shrimp avocado and mango salsa made up for it. This dish tasted really fresh, I would recommend it if you like crab and shrimp. 
Warm spinach dip, chips, and salsa- The salsa was delicious! Artichoke was mediocre. 

Chicken quesadillas- Nothing special
Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sliders- This was okay, wasn't extra savory or anything. 
Habanero wings- Disappointment. Wasn't spicy at all. 

Interior very spacious and our waiter was friendly. Will be back if in the area.

My boyfriend and I wish we had tried this place first when arriving to Las Vegas. Excellent, friendly service! We loved the environment. Felt like we were in the Bahamas with how it was set up. Delicious salmon and shrimp quesadilla. This is a place everyone should try when in Vegas. You will not be disappointed.

Absolutely love this place, every time my friends and I don't know what to do for dinner, we always head here. Waiters/waitresses are always nice, speedy, and the price is very good for the amount of food that they stack on your plates.

Mahi Fish tacos were bland and boring...no sauce ($11). The Salmon Special ($13) was dry & tasteless too.  We've loving this place for 5 years because of the amazing flavors and sauces.  Food today didn't have any of those amazing sauces and was void of flavor. Asked the waiter if they forgot the sauce but he said they no longer include the mango sauce with the tacos. I think hospital cafeteria food would have tasted better than what we had today. New cooks? New recipes? The table next to me complaining to the manager about their food too. Sad that one of my favorite restaurants lost it's mojo....but I'll give it 3 stars because the staff was nice and restaurant was clean.

Came back tonight & Tina waited on us. The food tonight was to die for. I took pictures of everything we had. I don't know what they did but everything is 100% The music was on point. I will bring friends and family to this location.
Good food for a decent price.  The pinapple upside down cake was chocolaty and amazing.  Our server, Rand, was great too.
If you like Caribbean flavors and cocktails, this is the restaurant for you. I would go back when in town.

Happy hours my thing...but I do not recommend going here for it. Bartender makes a stiff drink maybe too stiff and when it comes to the menu his recommends were poor we got the two spiciest things with no warning. This comes from a person that hates spice. When I go to a bar I like a personable bartender that asks what do u like what don't you like and when you get a response of oh I mainly just make drinks that turns a customer away. This the reason we left.

It's worth it just for the bathrooms, but this place is excellent for groups. If you're looking for a place to take a work group or hold some sort of work-related event, this place is great. The variety in food will please everyone. The atmosphere is great, and the price isn't too steep.

We hadn't been here in a while, so good to see their menu has been updated with some great dishes! We had tamarind margaritas (so good), a great dinner and a wonderful server: Jerry. Great customer service!

One of my favorite happy hours in town. Both regular & late night if I'm on this side of town. 1/2 off apps & great drink specials. I recommend the lobster & shrimp quesadillas, simply a must try for seafood lovers.
Great drinks and great food! Can't wait to return to vegas to eat again. A must stop everytime! Live music and great happy hour specials.

Food was awesome. Prices reasonable. The firecracker shrimp was the bomb. Calamari was super tender and the shrimp and lobster quesadillas were right on point. Our first time in Vegas and my cousin invited us. We know where to go when we go back! Oh and can forget the tropical margarita to wash it all down. It waiter was super nice as well. A must stop!
I was recommended the coconut shrimp and I was not disappointed by the coconut shrimp tacos I ordered. Yum!

We had a gift card that was good for one of several different restaurants, including the Yard House and Olive Garden. But the one that looked the most appealing (mostly, since we'd never heard of it) was Bahama Breeze. Seeing that the closest location was the one in Vegas, we saved the gift card for our trip to the Strip.

Walking in this place was like entering into a different world. It was amazing. They don't commit to theme so blatantly like Rainforest Cafe or places like that, but in a natural and organic way where it still feels homey. 

The lady who sat us down spent a couple minutes explaining to us what she liked best on the menu. Then, our waiter, Eamon, got over to us and he, too, gave us his take on the menu, breaking down each section, since he knew we had never been there before. 

I'm the type of guy that likes to get what's popular at any restaurant, so he informed me that the Jerk Chicken was their best item. 

I was hesitant about it, because jerk chicken has not really ever been my style. But with risk comes reward, and this reward was worth it.

The meal ($17) came with three large pieces of bone-in chicken, black beans, rice, and plantains. The chicken was some of the most moist I've ever eaten, and the spices on the chicken loaded it with some amazing flavors without ever being too spicy. You'll definitely remember the taste more than the spiciness. The black beans were probably the best I've had. And the plantains were great (if you like plantains), especially when dipped in the Caribbean salsa that they put there on the plate. The rice was a little too saffrony for me and I wasn't a big fan, but my fiancee loved it.

She ordered the Skillet Jerk Shrimp ($12), which was amazingly tasty! It was jam-packed with flavor, and came with a garlic-thyme butter sauce that I couldn't stop dipping the bread in (her dish came with a roll of bread). 

Altogether, this place will now be a mainstay on our trips into town, much like the Peppermill has become. The waiter was amazing and so was all of the food and the atmosphere. The prices, also, were very reasonable--especially considering what town we were in.
We had great service!!! And our food was totally awesome, we wish we had come here before!!

I would like to formally thank Bahama Breeze and their staff for their sincere efforts towards RUINING my family reunion dinner on Saturday, July 23, 2011.  God Bless my mother and my aunts for their hard work in putting this thing on and for keeping everyone else patient while this disaster was taking place.  This was by far the worst6 display of service I have ever seen and several formal letters are being sent to their corporate office as I write this.  

My family had made arrangements with their business office to hold our reunion here for a buffet-style dinner.  We do not live in Las Vegas (none of us do) so we did everything via fax and phone.  We have been to this location on several occasions over the years, so we are familiar with the food and always had really good service here.  I also always enjoyed the food, so we thought this would be the perfect place to host our family reunion dinner.  Anyway, so the contract we made was for three main entrees (seafood paella, baby back ribs and Jamaican grilled chicken) , three side dishes (yellow rice, green beans, creamed sweet potatoes) and their signature green salad.  This was all to be served buffet-style with unlimited choice of soft drinks, tea/coffee and iced tea. The price negotiated was $35 per person.  We brought in our own cakes for dessert which they kept in the back refrigerated for us.  This was a group of approximately 31 people.  Kids' menu items were to be paid for separately as well as cocktails, beer and wine. Each table would get their own bill for those things separately (and for anything else you want on the regular menu).

From the beginning, service problems began.  There were two servers who primarily came in our area.  Over the course of the evening, we had to literally chase these people down for drinks and just basic service.  It was horrible.  I noticed that the buffet serving containers were quite small for the amount of people in party and they emptied very quickly.  Nobody was there to replace to food.  People sat with food while others had to wait a long time before being able to get food.  The salad bowl probably could serve about 6 to 8 people, so when that emptied (no other food was out or available at this point), people just sat their for a good 20 minutes before they brought out more.  This was the ongoing theme of the night.  Need a refill on that ice tea? Be prepare to never get it unless you run around trying to find the waiter to get some.  Nobody was attending to our party.  Nobody was busing the plates so we literally had pile them in the middle table.  Kids' orders were not brought out in a timely manner so the kids were eating like an hour into dinner service.  Remember the tea and coffee? None was offered to anyone and we paid for it!  And to top off , when the staff did make an appearance, they had really nasty attitudes about it.  No apologies.  So where was the manager in all this? Certainly not rolling up his sleeves trying to help his clearly overwhelmed waitstaff.  He was somewhere else, making excuses that there were other big parties going on.  NOT OUR PROBLEM.  

Look, this was clearly an understaffed event and the lack of attention to ANY sort of detail shows that, but come on! It was just blatantly bad.  Poor attitude and unapologetic staff is just a reflection of the management's nonchalance for literally pissing all over this party.  We had babies crying from hunger, we had piled up dirty plates, plenty of empty glasses and annoyed family members.  Thank goodness we are good spirited people, kept the party going and did our raffles and announcements and passed out cake as planned. We tried not to let our experience at Bahama Breeze ruin our getting to catch up with each other and have fun, but damn! Work with us here! We could have just gone to a buffet at one of the casinos for this and we probably should have.

 Oh and I haven't even gotten to how salty the food was!  The paella was nearly inedible even though they did not skimp on seafood, does it matter if they pour a whole container of salt in it?  Dry chicken, hard to cut with my knife.  However, the ribs were decent as were the green beans and sweet potatoes..but wait..something was missing.  Mom did not realize this until after but they forgot our yellow rice.  We have a few people in our party who are allergic to seafood so the paella was out, hence the reason for the yellow rice side.  I guess everything else was so bad we forgot about the missing side. Anyway, my mom called their business office and got it refunded.  Either way, I could think of sooo many other places to host a dinner like this that would have gone so much smoother.  They really should be ashamed for doing such a sloppy-ass job.
Messed up all drinks. They tried to fix but to no avail. Food is good though. Don't expect this to be like the ones in south Florida.

We had a work event here so everything was free. I had no idea that Bahama Breeze was a franchise because there is one in Raleigh North Carolina

Food was good, a lot of fried food though, so beware!

We started out wanting some good drinks, non alcoholic of course, and it was happy hour. We asked if the non alcoholic drinks were available at a discount and thy told us only the alcoholic drinks were. We didn't understand so we requested a manager. So far not so good...but the manager had a change of heart...so that was good. We shared a chicken cilantro cream dish that was fabulous. We also had some great chicken sliders, coconut shrimp, and some chicken wings.
Overall it was great food, fast service, and cool atmosphere. 
We will defnitely come back.

This was the third time we have visited the Bahama Breeze in Las Vegas and it has been stellar each time.  The food choices are great and the quality excellent.    Our service has always been outstanding and the food delivered has been fresh and hot.  This is one of our favorite places to stop at when we are in town and the prices are very reasonable, especially for Vegas.  Very enjoyable and the service was excellent.
We went here for lunch and drinks. We had several appetizers, drinks and entrees. It was all delicious! Our server Joe was awesome as well. Will definitely come back!

Set up is really nice but doesn't make up for everything else. The food is bland and really has no taste. I got the portobello manchega (no taste) my girl got some sort of shrimp plate that just tasted like tomato. Ill give them this, the beef empanadas and artichoke dip were pretty good. House drinks were also very good. Service started off really helpful but drifted shortly. Having the little one with us we found ourselves making a trip to the restroom that you could smell from the bar so watch your step. Don't see us coming back

We were looking for a reception site for our wedding that was laid back and would give us more time to actually mingle with our guests.  We decided on Bahama Breeze, and it was great!  The food was fantastic!  Our reception was at 9pm so we did the appetizer buffet for about 25 people, and everyone loved the food!  The atmosphere was light and fun, and I think everyone had a good time!  The only reason I only gave it 4 stars was because a few times throughout the night the staff would come up to me and ask me what to do or what needed to be done, and I kind of felt like it should be their job to already know what should/needed to be done.  Other than that the staff was very friendly and we enjoyed ourselves!

We decided to veer off the Strip in search for something different and not "Strip-priced" and ended up at Bahama Breeze.

We were pleasantly surprised at their menu, as they offered some of our favorite types of food!  I ordered the jerk chicken wings (of course!) and my daughter ordered their West Indies Patties.  Both were awesome!  The service was also good and our drinks were never empty.

We will definitely keep this place in mind next time we're in town!

Had a really good time here the food was amazing and it was the bonus happy hours on!!!! Appetisers were 50% off the drink was good the food was amazing and our bar girl Shelly was ours standing and Louis had us all laughing the name night long

My girlfriend got me hooked on this place...  The jerk fire shrimp!!!!  YES YES!!!  please ask for the sauce be chunky and the bread that you can dip into the chuncky sauce!!! YES YES!!!   :)   The coconut shrimp is recommended as well...!!!

If you go to this place during the happy hour for $20 you can get full on the appetizers(jerk shrimp as I recommend) and at least two drinks.... 

And during the peak hours on the weekends, this is a place you can chill with that special someone and and enjoy a romantic eveing out...
Less pricey than hotel food and just as good! The drinks were pretty good too. The waitress was a little slow, but she did have quite a few tables.

Service without a SMILE.

2 nights ago I visited this restaurant (Bohama Breeze) based on a recommendation of a friend who said that it would be a fun and tasty experience.It was neither......I left thinking that I have  more fun at Denny's or Jack in the Box.,  i was prepared to just talk about the under par service my group received, but I looked in the faces of the staff and did not see one smile on one face.  Then I wondered if the theory was correct "A staff treats the customers the same way the management treats them.... then I am glad I do not wor here.   

The service is fair.... by that I mean all the appropriate words were spoken at the appropriate time..  The food was not  worth returning for a second taste..   Skip this experience you won't miss a thing.

Variety of food and great selection. This place is great if you feel like having a big dinner or small plates and salads. Great service and delicious food. Our server, Jerry, went above and beyond to make out time special. There was also a reggae band playing. All in all, it was a perfect experience. I will definitely come back next time I am in Vegas.
First time here again out with my gorgeous wifey,  great Sunday. Hung out nice lunch , took a Sunday afternoon nap now hanging in Vegas.  Life is Good

After dinner drink and snacks on Wednesday, 8/5/15 (first time visiting)

I came with a huge party of about 40 people. It took about 30 minutes to be seated in the cabana area. They have a parking lot but it got full pretty fast. The servers were friendly. We grabbed drinks from the bar area while waiting for our table.

Outside the restaurant near our tables, they have a performer playing live music. There's a dance floor too.

The appetizers we had were average tasting. We ordered the coconut shrimp, chicken wings, onion rings fried with coconut flakes, garlic shrimp with bread, and mojitos. 

I haven't gotten a chance to try items off their regular menu. In terms of enjoying ourselves for late night entertainment and light refreshments, it was great especially with 40 of us all together. They were able to split our checks too.

No question my worse meal ever in LV; covering 40 years of coming here each year.  My friends didn't care for their meals either.  Chicken and chorizo pasta, crab avocado salad or fish tacos- all terrible.  No one should like writing a bad review; me especially, but terrible is terrible.  Won't be back.
Restaurant is super cute.  Was asked to sit in the bar since I was alone.  Service was very friendly and efficient.  Had the coconut shrimp.  They were good but nothing spectacular.

I am never disappointed when I come to Bahama Breeze. The food is always quick, hot, and DELICIOUS!!! MMMMMMMMMM! the customer service is superb. My favorite dish, well appetizer, is the Jerk Shrimp! It's comes with bread for you to dip in the sauce and it is absolutely delicious!!! You gotta try this place!
Great service! I came on a weekday after the lunch rush and enjoyed fast service.  I sat at the bar with Bob. Enjoyed a coupla tasty mojitos! The coconut shrimp are awesome!

Seriously? Chicken wings came out in 3 minutes. That's amazing! How can you cook chicken in 3 minutes?
Chorizo sliders were soggy, had to send them back. If you're looking for pre-made food this is your place. If you like good, quality food I don't recommend Bahamas Breeze.

We sent back 2 dishes and decided not to order anything else. My entire mouth was assaulted by salt. 

We tried the West Indies Chicken Curry rice bowl and it was so aggressively salted, we sent it back after 2 bites and then selected the Jerk Chicken Pasta. Unfortunately, that was also crazy salty; I couldn't get another bite in, my tastebuds and mouth were completely ruined and shriveled up.

The flavor profile of each dish was also shockingly basic - It didn't offer up any of the Caribbean flavors or seasonings that were promised. The Jamaican jerked chicken was dried out and I didn't even taste much jerk seasoning - only salt. To be fair, the dinner entree portions were gigantic. One dish is perfect for 3 people to share. 

Also, the appetizers were average. We tried the chicken empanadas and they were extremely doughy with minimal filling. The only dish that was decent was the fried coconut shrimp appetizer, however, I have to explicitly state that Elephant Bar and Yard-House makes it better. 

The manager came to talk to us at the end and was very defensive about the salt usage in both dishes. He also offended us by suggesting that we probably didn't know what jerk seasoning tasted like. lol. I'm not even going to argue it. We ended up heading to In-N-Out and grabbing some burgers after this failed dinner.

Happy Hour M-F 4-6pm and Su-Th 9-close

Happy Hour Specials are $3-$5 drink specials and half priced appetizers.  

Came in for Rumtoberfest and to check out some drink flights I had seen online.  Drink flights are my fave cause I love trying everything.  Started with the Higgla's Happy Juice a 3 cocktail flight.  It was OK so we decided to order The Rum Raid an 8 cocktail flight.  We didn't realize that it had 3 of the same flavors as our previous flight.  Most of the cocktails tasted very similar, surprisingly we only liked a few.  We finished off with a margarita flight and that was by far the best drinks of the night.  

For food we ordered Jamaican Chicken Wings, Key West Nachos, Coconut Shrimp, Firecracker Shrimp and Lobster & Shrimp Quesadilla.  Food was good.  Nothing amazing but a great price at half off.  Portions were large.  I was disappointed that the nachos did not have plantain chips like it said on the menu.  

Service was average.  We had multiple bartenders in the few hours we were there.  None of them were very personable or friendly.

Hearty food, good flavor and good quality. 

I wasn't dazzled but I left full. The Jerk chicken pasta was great but Huge! Service was good and ample free parking. 

I kinda felt like I was in an all inclusive resort in the Bahamas. Anyway, I would eat here again but I wasn't blown away.

Had a good dinner out. There was half price appetizers and drink specials from 4-6.  Isha was our server and she was very nice and on top of everything.  Will definitely be back to try some of their drinks.
I have slept on this little gem.  The avocado & crab salad is a must!  Very reasonably priced and a good family atmosphere.

This place is casual .....next to the strip I took my friend there for his birthday lunch because that's where he wanted to go... This was my first time here it is a Saturday we went at 2 PM no reservation was needed it was not packed however we were unable to sit outside because the servers had closed it for some reason so I was a bit disappointed. The reason this place gets four stars is because the server was great the service was amazing she was super attentive super nice and gave us a lot of recommendations. We ordered the Caribbean lobster and Mac and cheese plate the lobster was fried and it was oh so delicious... I made the mistake of getting a Caesar salad which was good but my eyes definitely went for the spinach dip and chips that we ordered as an appetizer... As far as drinks get the Hibiscus Margarita !!!tasted like juice yum!!! Or the Tamarind margarita with 1800 Reposado !!!...the whole meal for two with appetizers and drinks and even a chocolate dessert and $20 tip came out total $113!!!! Pretty good for all we ate !!!
Food was good. Hospitality and service was great. Got a table right away. Food tasted great. Great food variety. I just feel like I have to go there a few more times to try different foods.

The first time we went we were seated right away due to our reservation, we were seated outside, the environment was very relaxed, very roomy, played good music (sometimes a band will play) and service was very quick. The food was really good and properly cooked. We were constantly checked every 10 mins or so.

Second time was good as well, again seated right away due to our reservation, the lady at the frontdesk was a bit rude but only to her bussers, the table wasnt properly set but they fixed it right away once we acknowledge it. Same thing, the food was great and we were constantly checked. Overall, I loved it and we will definitely going back here.
Such a fun and tropical and happy feeling environment. The service was very good, although not very personal. The food is a little better than average. The cocktails are delicious.

Thanks to my boyfriend for introducing me to this place. They got a wide variety of selections to chose from. We went for lunch and prices were the norm.
There were plenty of appetizers and alcoholic beverages available. So for those of you who do happy hour with co workers, friends, significant others, on a date...etc..I think this would be a great place to go to whichever the occasion is.

For those who are always indecisive with decisions, Bahama Breeze's menu may be hard for you to choose just one thing to order. I was in between a couple dishes but in the end, I went for something healthy: a shrimp rice bowl with grilled/sauteed veggies. Portions were on point for lunch. It was just the right amount to fill me up without that "ugh, I feel so fat and bloated" feeling. However, I DO get full easily though so hmm... My boyfriend got the Caribbean jerk chicken pasta. There was mushrooms in it also. Mine cost $8.95 and his pasta cost....$10-13 I think??? It's been awhile so don't quote me on the exact prices.

I will definitely be back.

Went to dinner before the JT concert...had the mahi mahi with a light sauce. Nicely done, very moist pan seared. 

Ordered a makers mark whiskey sour, enjoyed that too. Drinks came out timely...all our meals were ready at the same time and prepared well. 

Gold star for Brandon, our server, thank you!

love the feeling bahamamamabreezetaculars give me. brings me back to when i lived in hawaoo. mood lightened up with the quickness.

i started off with the layered pina coolada. and best brain freeze i ever had immediately ocurred. amaazing.

to feel like a non fatass i started with the tropical salad w mixed greens and veggies and all that bs.. and the chicken by itself was superbilicious!!

wasnt enough so i ordered my fat ass a burger with extra bacon. bada bing!

oh i love the vibe here but i def hate myself after i get out everytime

MUST START: with the layered pina colada

MUST TRY: tropical salad (this by itself is enough for the faint stomached)

I hadn't been there in years because I remembered spicey food, which I am not crazy about.  Obviously, I didn't know what to order.  A friend and I went there for lunch, and I had a memorable and fabulous meal.  In fact, there was so much food, I had three fabulous meals, and everything was almost as good as leftovers the next two days.  We started out with a virgin cocktail combining layers of slushy kiwi, mango, strawberry and margarita flavors, followed by an excellent house salad with a tasty citrus vinegarette house dressing.  The Shrimp and Lobster Linguine with mushrooms in a cream and brandy sauce was mouth-wateringly delicious.
