For dessert, I had the chocolate mousse on a brownie base covered with whipped cream, toasted almond slices, chocolate sauce and Creme Anglaise.  I'd go back just to have that again.  It was a little pricey for lunch, but would be reasonable for dinner.  Our server, Tim, went out of his way to be friendly and helpful.  We had our choice of indoor or outdoor dining.  It was a delightful experience in all aspects.

Wandered into Bahama Breeze on Memorial Day Weekend and were seated right away. The restaurant is fabulously decorated in a tropical island theme and overall is a good place to go and avoid the chaos of The Strip.  

Whether you sit outside or on the patio, you will get the feel of the islands. Although the food is good, it can get a bit pricey for what it is. I had the Jamaican grilled chicken and it was $18. Tasty but $18 is a bit steep. My wife had a sandwhich for around $12.

The signature Mojito, "Mojito Cubano"  was overly fufu.  They pack the drink with ice and make it like a slushy.  I asked for my second with significantly less ice and it still had too much.  

Given the ambiance and good food, I have given 4 stars.  I look forward to going back.
Really enjoyed the firecracker shrimp, the outdoor seating is very breezy and nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful would def come back again

Shelly made our stop great!  We had more than two bad experiences at Satay across the street.

The food was awesome.  I had the jerk chicken and my wife had chipotle beef!  Awesome.

The ultimate pineapple drink! WOW!

A chain.  Ate at another one in a different state. I had a seafood paella that was dry and didn't have much flavor.  Expensive too for  the quality. Didn't seem fresh but we are in Las vegas as far as fish goes.  My husband got the shrimp and lobster quesadillas and they seemed ok.  Drinks weren't very good either. The Yelp happy hours weren't right.  It said 3-6, but didn't start till 4-6.  They should have honored the price due to wrong advertisement!  Anyway, won't go back!

Highly disappointing! I'm a researcher and please believe I did my due diligence to see what was popular, and what everyone loves here. I had the Beef empanadas (they were ok) shrimp pasta (super bland and watery so I sent it back) and my friend had the fried chicken (plate was super cold and we had to send it back). I then got the jerk shrimp appetizer and it was fine but nothing to write home about.  Not authentic Caribbean in any way shape or form. I did like the music and the ambiance as cool. Also my server was very nice so those are the two stars! Not coming here again.

Newer items and portion smaller. Quality still good as well as drinks are strong. Price for two about 80.00. Great family place and a nice location away from strip. Still had to box home so portions that are sliced are not really that small.

We thought we would try this place because we were close by and were in the mood for some fruity drinks. 

I had the skinny mojito and my lady had the bahama-rita. The drinks were the best part of our experience. Both were awesome and reasonably priced. 

We had the fish taco's and a cheeseburger. The fish taco's tasted like a sewer, but my cheeseburger was ok. The quality of ground meat wasn't really of my liking, but the avocado was great. 

This place is huge and it felt like we were secluded in our own little corner--too lonely.  I definately would have preferred to sit closer to the center of the restaurant.  I don't think they clean that part of the building because we saw a lot of dust falling from somewhere right above our food. The table light illuminated the particles as we covered our drinks and plates with our hands. Ummm yeah. A few more drinks and we probably wouldn't have noticed. Unfortunately we weren't that saucy.  

WIth so many good restaurants in the area, I don't think we will be back.
Luis always makes the best drinks and the happy hour can't be beat. One of mine and my girlfriends favorite spots for our night off

Early lunch before we headed back to Cali. We had just came in from a flight from NY and decided to have lunch before we left the area. We had saw this place a week before we left and decided to give it a try. The theme is Caribbean cuisine. Lots of jerk choices and non jerk choices but just think being away on an island. The vibe and music playing all a taste of Caribbean and reggae tunes. We had beef empanadas, fresh juicy fried chicken sandwiched by fried green plantain, oxtails chicken tortilla soup (more chunks of chicken than soup) and jackfruit tacos. The food was tasty and fresh. They had a plethora of drink choices but since we were driving we didnt partake. But they looked yummy!

I ordered a specialty drink that I requested be tweaked a little bit. The bartender came over to make sure he was making exactly what I wanted and it turned out delicious; Mango Jalapeno Mojito, YUM! 

Leilani was our server and she was great! She had awesome recommendations. I had the Lobster Mac & Cheese and Firecracker shrimp for an app. I would order both again.

They had live music majority of our visit. Great atmosphere. Will return and will request Leilani

I love Bahama Breeze. I've eaten at several in the U.S. and this one is just as great as the others. The tropical drinks put you in a real island state of mind. I love the Rum Runner on the rocks. Reminds me of laying on a beautiful beach in Florida! The jerk chicken is great. Just like the jerk chicken in the Caribbean that I've tasted. Also the empanadas are very good too. There are a lot of great dishes here from full plate steaks down to specialty tacos and of course wonderful burgers custom made! Save room for dessert. Rebecca's Key Lime Pie is homemade and tastes like you're in Key West! Such a good place to go when you're craving food from anywhere in the Caribbean islands.

Dining here with my husband during a non busy time .Very disappointing service - Kurt ( name on the receipt) was our server and I ordered the fish tacos after specifically asking if the flour tortillas could be substituted for corn - at first he said " we don't to that" and the. I said - I can't east wheat could you ask- and then he came back to say he could have them made with corn. When the food came out I started with my soup, and then  went to take a bite of the tacos and realized the tortillas were flour. I quickly empty the content of tacos I to my soup bowl right when Kurt was walking by to ask how our food was - I told him that the tortillas were still flour and he said " let me take them out of your way ' wow no attempt at service recovery ,no offer to bring out corn tortillas and no apology! We are locals who would have been back as This was our first visit and based on this experience it will be our last - please teach your team how to make things up of they make a mistake - everyone understands that things happen but staff need to know how to make it right when they screw up

Love this place! The atmosphere is so inviting and relaxing. The food is great and they make amazing drinks! The service is awesome and they all seem to like working there!
I am planning my 20th class reunion and I want to have our banquet here and I can't wait for next year to get here! The packages they sent are reasonable and I'm sure we will have an awesome time!!! Until then I will continue to visit them when I'm in the mood for Caribbean food and the BOMB drinks!

We went here today for lunch (Sunday) and sat out in the indoor patio. The place was not crowded at all and so we got a lot of attention from our AWESOME server, Gerald. He was really silly and down to earth; he didnt have to try to impress us to make us like him! I got a salad with fruit and shrimp and it was heavenly! Got the top shelf margarita as well - it was a little more sour than im used to but was still pretty good. Overall, beautiful restaurant for a calm weekend lunch. We both felt like we were far away from the Vegas desert dining in there!

Wonderful food, I highly suggest the fire cracker shrimp or Habanero wings. Great service, shout out to Chanel for the amazing first impression and Donna for the outstanding service as well.
Bahama Breeze the place to go! I wish we had one in Arizona!
My half tried their mahi-mahi, it wasn't to his appeal.  The jerk chicken is so good.
I haven't been here in years - the food and service was Great. I like the menu... Nice variety and don't forget the desserts

I went here Monday night with girlfriend's Cuban family with high expectations because someone recommended it to us. Exterior was very fancy, and beachy. The restaurant is bigger than I thought with many sections. 

I scrolled through Yelp to search for references of what to order. My family end up ordered Cheese Curds (cheese stuffed fried yucca) Jamaican Jerky Chicken, Seafood Paellas, a stack of Short Ribs BBQ, Cheddar Burger and fries sweet plantain. We loved the Cheese Curds. They were crunchy, cheese oozed delicious. We ended up with two orders of that. The Jamaican Jerky Chicken was delicious, the portion was huge! Half a chicken grilled with special sauce and yellow rice with fried sweet plantains. The plantains were thick cut and fried to perfection. We Cubans loved it. The Seafood Paellas were not that great. The consistency wasn't really true Paella but the flavor was there. The seafood wasn't as fresh, mussels slightly overcooked, though fish was flaky and cooked well. Paellas weren't impressive, average, but portion was also very big! Each can easily feed two people. My sister-in-law's burger was good (you can't go wrong with burger they should all taste how they should taste). My BBQ ribs were ok, again, they tasted just like how should taste. Sweet and smokey. There wasn't any special twist or spin added onto it. 

Overall the experience was meh. With the bill $120 in total, we expected more. It was filling but wasn't satisfying. I heard good things about it, but maybe we ordered the wrong things because everything was just ok.

Terrific place for a date! I had the Coconut Shrimp appetizer, which came with a sweet & spicy sauce! The Piña Colada drink was delicious, very sweet, & I don't think I could drink two because of that. I ordered the Mahi Mahi with a mango and pineapple glaze. The fish was cooked perfect, the presentation of the plate with the crisped banana slices inserted into the sweet potatoes with cinnamon was a fancy touch. We'll definitely be back, even though it was a drive from our house!

I loved this place- nice Caribbean decorating, extremely friendly servers, good prices and a great menu. 

We ordered the 
Coconut shrimp tacos-amazing
Lobster and shrimp quesadilla was great
Beef bowl delicious
Steak was perfectly cooked

Our first night-Margo was our server and she was sweet, funny, informative and attentive. 

I enjoyed it so much.... several nights later when most of my friends went to Morton's- I opted to come back with my daughter. Our server on the second night was Anita- and she was just as excellent as Margo. 

We ordered the tacos (so good had to choose them again) 
Protein style cheese burger- just "ok"
Adler beer is INCREDIBLE 

Top notch waitresses, yummy food, fun atmosphere and good prices. Can not go wrong her!
Excellent service, nice atmosphere, good food, and great drinks. This restaurant was next to our hotel and we went there on more than one occasion.  Nice "at home" feel while you're on vacation.

We come here periodically when we have out of town guests.  Everyone seems to enjoy the menu and food. I finally decided to write a review of 2 visits this past week.  The first was mid-week with a party of 10.  There was a special lunch menu that offered perfect portions.  Everyone loved the salads and I love the beef empanadas.  The food was very tasty and was served fresh and hot items were hot.  The service couldn't have been better.  
We went again on Sunday and got the same great service by Alexis H. and the food was again very good.  We appreciate that the service and food here are so consistently wonderful.

We've come here many times and the experience is always great!  The Jamaican Jerk Wings are so delicious and full of flavor we get them every time.  We try to get different things and every dish has been spot on!  This time I got the sirloin topped with crab and served with mashed potatoes and the steak was cooked perfectly!  Our server was awesome and gave us great recommendations-we talked as if we had known each other for years- a great time:)

Had a wonderful lunch. Our server Troy was on top of everything. He made sure the baby's food was served right away. He checked back frequently and was always positive and helpful. Everything we ordered, food and drink, was top notch. Really...it's not just the rum talking ;)

This place never disappoints. I eat here every time I come to Vegas. Thia trip I had a crab cake with cilantro lime dressing. It was delicious as I expected! The almond crusted salmon was fresh, flaky, and cooked just right.   I can drink their coconut mojitos over...and over...and over!! 

Our waiter, Jessie, was the best! He was helpful in referring foods to my friend and kept us laughing the entire time we were there.

My family and I have been here a few dozen times over the past couple of years. Never had a bad experience or meal. Friendly service that is more than happy to provide accommodations if you have food allergies (I don't, but my family does). Great place!

The drinks are the best part of this restaurant they are all good but I suggest the The frozen drinks Their so good I like the Ultimate piña colada. The lobster Mac and cheese is rely good  also the jerk chicken

I'm not a fan of Caribbean food but do love the food offered here! The portion sizes are great and most dishes you can choose small or large. 
I'm a huge fan of their coconut shrimp tacos (choice of 2 or 3). The tacos come with a generous amount of coconut shrimp and an added spice is added with their house style pico. Last night I ordered this dish with a side of their beef tomato salad. The tomatoes were tossed in a vinaigrette and topped with fresh basil. Bold fresh flavors in every bite! My boyfriend always enjoys the Jamacian jerk chicken pasta. I've never tried it but it looks delicious (if you like jerk chicken). Bowtie pasta is tossed with asparagus, mushrooms and of course chicken. This is another dish you have the choice between large or small.
We came late and took advantage of their happy hour. We don't drink but they offer half off, full size appetizers. If you love quesadillas you have to try theirs! Cheesy, bold flavors and deliciousness!!
Our server last night was Fred. He was so nice and very attentive. Our drinks were never empty and our table was always manicured. He was extremely friendly but allowed us to enjoy our meal without being overbearing. Thank you Fred! I really appreciated your service last night.

Maybe 3 stars isn't nice, but not all places deserve 4 or 5. I'm getting picky. 
My husband loves this place and we've eaten here nearly every day this week.
And that's ok.  He likes the Cobb Salad with jerk chicken added, plus feta cheese,  no bacon. 
This time I got a grilled honey chicken dish with mashed potatoes.  It was fine.  Not incredible.
We like to sit at the bar, you always get better service when you sit at a bar.
The staff here is always great and the various drink options look tasty!

The best happy hour to go in my opinion! The food to the drinks to the service. They have their game on! Very affordable prices on happy hour menu. I'll suggest sit at the bar section because they have some amazing bartenders back there very friendly and provided amazing service. Jamaican wings and jerk shrimp is a must have. It was tasty! Food came out quick and my drinks never left empty. Good job guys!

Caribbean Chicken Jerk pasta is good.

Service: 
The person that was with me ordered something outside of the menu and the waiter happily searched for it and came thru. 

They close at 11pm.
Yum! Happy hour is the best! 9 to 12 midnight! Th empanadas are so tender and flakey! Oh my! Love the drinks and with happy hour!!! I will be here every night!

I received a gift card for a Darden Restaurant for Christmas.  Choice of dining at Red Lobster, Olive Garden, Longhorn Steakhouse, Seasons 52, or Bahama Breeze.  I was recommended by some Las Vegas residents to try Bahama Breeze. 

Wednesday night on January 14, 2015 was the first time I visited Bahama Breeze to have a meal.  This night I had my cousin and her family from Henderson join me for the dinner.  I found out that they have not eaten at Bahama Breeze as well.  A first time dining experience for the entire family to enjoy.

A total of six individuals in our group (M1, M2, and M3 are the men.  F1, F2, and F3 are the females).  F1 (my cousin) ordered the garden salad and the ribs with fries.  F2 (me) ordered the Bahamian Seafood Chowder and Buttermilk Chicken Piccata with mashed potatoes.  M1 (cousin's companion) ordered the coconut shrimp appetizer as well as the coconut shrimp meal with broccoli.  M2 (companion's son) ordered a Portabello Burger with fries.  M3 (cousin's son) and F3 (companion's daughter) both ordered pasta.  One had asparagus and mushroom in the pasta while the other eliminated the asparagus.  Everyone finished their meal.  They all agreed that what they ordered for dinner was delicious.  Each dish was served with the right portion...just enough to make a person stuffed to the max. 

The restaurant itself is pretty big.  There's one section of the restaurant that can be used for reserved parties and it had a television for the customers to watch.  There was dinner music provided by a man playing the guitar and he sang a lot of cover songs.  He was located near the bar area and right behind the wishing pond.  The ceiling fans are actually the propellers from the boats.  The restrooms were very clean and there was a mouthwash dispenser for customers to use before or after a meal....that's one thing you hardly see in restaurant restrooms.  

Overall everyone enjoyed the first time dining experience here at Bahama Breeze.  Employees were friendly and the waiters made sure that the drinks were not empty. Facility was clean and very beautiful.  Another major plus about the restaurant is that Bahama Breeze passed the Nevada health inspection by receiving a grade A. For my cousin and her extended family it would be a once in every six months treat for date night or family outings since the entree items are pricey.

Don't get me wrong, but this place was OK. The portions for what you pay is just ridiculous. One of my group members had ordered a Jamaican flavored chicken wings or something and it came out with like 2-3 wings. I ordered mildly flavored chicken wings and it looked like the microwaveable chicken wings from WalMart or Smiths. I had about 3 pieces of wings and a little bits of rice spread about to make it look whole on the plate. Idk about everyone else, but wouldn't go here again..

I used to work for Bahama Breeze, St. Louis, so I looked forward to going in and critiquing how this one was run.

The salmon I ordered was delicious, they have taken off the island rice, don't like the new rice. 

Service was good as usual, the servers are always very knowledgeable about the menu and they did not charge me to make a weird substitution. 

The garlic mashed potatoes recipe has clearly changed and they were very....well...shiny? If that makes sense, it was clear to me that they were not handmade or fresh like the used to be, so sorry, you lost a star over my potatoes.

Overall, enjoyable, they have very good specialty drinks. Bill was about $55.00 dollars before tip for three people, with one specialty drink on the bill and no desserts.

This is still my go-to restaurant on my Las Vegas visits... the last couple times have been disappointing though because my favorite menu items were discontinued.

But I decided to try it again and went with something totally new: the ropa vieja sandwich with the side of fruit, no sorbet.

The sandwich was pretty good, could have used something to add flavor or spice but I would get it again.

The next time you're in Vegas, (particularly on E. Flamingo) don't fool yourself into thinking that Bahama Breeze is some run-of-the-mill, cookie cutter restaurant, a la Applebee's, Chili's etc... 

Simply put: Baham Breeze is the sh*t... mon! I wasn't even hungry and I almost finished my big ass plate of Calypso Shrimp Linguine. Might I add that they use 'Gulf Shrimp' in their shrimp dishes, which if you don't already know ,are not not small shrimp. My wife had the Wood Grilled Tilapia, my son had the Wood Grilled Chicken and my sister had the Jerk chicken and every single one of their dishes were excellent. For appetizers we had the Artichoke dip and the Jerk Shrimp, again both delicious.  
So the next time you're in Vegas, get out of your fancy hotel and treat yourself out to something different and worth your money!
We went to Bahama Breeze again last night...This makes about 7-8 times now.  They do not disappoint. Service was great and so was the meal.

This place is very cute, yes. But the food is whatev. Service could definitely be better. And I don't understand why they call themselves Caribbean..they serve Olive Garden food (plus a little more seafood.)

Nonetheless, I ordered the shrimp linguine..and it was ok. A bit on the salty side and the pasta was just a little overcooked. The boyfriend ordered the pork tenderloin with garlic mashed potatoes. Potatoes were delicious..pork, not so much. It was very dry and didn't have enough flavor.

Anyway, this is a great place for big groups..if you have money that is. Expect to pay $30 a person..and more if you're drinking.

This is formula fast food with a menu you look down at and pay too much for. Almost not worth writing a review, The Special Jerk Chicken is not even close to being a jerk. The mashed potatoes were beaten into a sticky gooey glue-like mess. The wife asked for Jerk-style ribs and got what the waiter said was a mango based jerk sauce. The Onion Rings were rock-hard tasteless hoops and the chicken wings were over-done and leather like. The high noise level made for difficult conversation. However the margarita was over-the-top and presented well. Go for the drinks and skip the food.

This place was really good. Stopped by with friends for lunch. 
The building is huge inside with a cool water feature as you enter. Two bars to choose from.
I ordered the Cuban. it was great. Tho I can't really recall much detail because I forgot to review right after I ate there and it's now like two months ago. BUT ! I can say we all enjoyed our meals and the customer service was great. 
I recommend stopping by.

Great place to go for happy hour, apps, drinks and beer are cheap, they got some great food too and I love this place, they have a few sides for a patio with palm trees all around to give you the island feel lol

I love Bahama Breeze and sad that there isn't a California location. I am a big fan of their pan seared salmon pasta, however I learned it's been discontinued from their menu for years now :( (I was lucky last pregnancy, supposedly they still had the ingredients to make it when it was already discontinued) I'm very bummed because I drove from California just to satisfy my pregnancy cravings. I ordered their jerk chicken pasta instead which used to be my old favorite and it's still delicious. I told my family I probably won't be crazy about Bahama Breeze anymore since my favorite dish is no longer served. But..! my brother had ordered their Steak Oscar and I had a teeny bite and oh my! It was super yummy! There I was, sucked back in. Guess I will have to come back after I pop out this baby. Steak was topped off with crab meat in a creamy sauce and had such great flavors. Out of all our dishes that night, the steak was probably the best one ordered. My family really enjoyed their Long Island iced tea and I had their virgin pina colada which they are known for. My sister in law and I were also very impressed by their kids portion. We had ordered bow tie pasta for our kids and the portions were very generous for such a good reasonable price. 

Also, I didn't order their haberno wings this time as I get major heartburn with pregnancy. But their haberno wings are always a hit!

Can you believe this was my first time here after living in Vegas almost 20 years?! This is one of my new favorite places! When we walked in I felt like I was on an island getaway. We were greeted by 3 very friendly staff members who escorted us to our table and introduced us to our server Deja who was the sweetest! She welcomed us and gave us their daily specials as well as made some recommendations when we weren't sure what to order. I love the atmosphere here it makes you so relaxed and they have the best selection of tropical vacation drinks, you know the kind with the little umbrellas haha. Our food came out lightning fast! Our appetizer was the Breeze Cheese Bites which are crisp fried yuca stuffed with melted cheese and cilantro crema dipping sauce. It was ok, to be honest it wasn't something I would order again because the "melted cheese" wasn't melted it was just a stick of cheese inside a fried yuca ball. For my entree I ordered the coconut shrimp tacos (2) and Deja recommended the fresh fruit with sorbet for my side which was amazing! The fish tacos were good but they were really spicy! I know it came with sriracha aioli but wow they were hotter than expected. The coconut shrimp had good flavor and the size was good too. The tortillas were cold and kind of hard. Ill come back because of the excellent service but order something else next time. This would be a great place to come with a group of friends they have a pretty big selection of food and drinks!
Great food and also nice inside. My super picky family left raving about how delicious and fresh everything was. On top of it all, the prices are very reasonable!

This is one of my favorite restaurants to come and spend some time with the wife is love how thay decorated the whole place to have a tropical theme along with the live music makes it that much better  there happy hour is the best thay have so much to choose from and the drinks and food are amazing  today my waiter was amon he was always making sure my cup  was always full great customer service is love everything about  Bahama breeze

Since I'm a huge lover of island cusine this is my go to place, not only do they have the best happy hour menu in town they have awesome drinks one in particular the Bahama Rita, reasonable price decent size and great on taste.
 I've dined here on many occasions, always pleased with my visit but tonight a group of coworkers and I decided to stop in for a late meal and we were served by a server named "Tina" not only did Tina give us awesome customer service she made us feel welcomed, she was patient, and had an outgoing sense of humor definitely one of the best visits I've had. 
With that being said if your ever in the mood for an awesome drink and meal at a reasonable price stop by during happy hour and ask for Tina I assure you, you will not be disappointed.
Good food, great drinks and yummy deserts - its like Olive Garden for the Island Fare.

I was looking forward to trying bahama breeze after passing it quite a few times. I saw that they have happy hour and was finally able to go with my sister and her BF. 

Lots of parking and a really great environment with live music. We weren't in the main dining room, but we were in the room with the live music and beachy feel which was great. I enjoyed the atmosphere. 

Our server took a while to come by, she might have been on break or something. By the time she came, we had already looked over the menu and knew what we wanted to order. Our food came out quickly after we placed our order.

Lobster and shrimp quesadilla: unfortunately it was our least favorite dish. I didn't get to taste much lobster and I felt it was lacking some flavor or spice.

Coconut shrimp: their most popular appetizer but it wasn't crispy enough for me. It was pretty good but I was hoping for a stronger coconut flavor. My sister loved this dish. 

Seared ahi tuna: 5/5!!! I could eat an entire plate (or 2) but unfortunately I had to share. The ahi tuna tasted fresh and the salad went very well with it. The mango glaze wasn't over powering either. 

Habanero chicken wings: we probably should have ordered the Jamaican jerk wings. While the portion was really big, we did not enjoy the wings. It was spicy but the BBQ and habanero didn't mix very well IMO. 

I had been wanting a frozen bahamarita all day and it did not disappoint me. I'm pretty sensitive to alcohol and yes... I'm one of THOSE people who get super red after half a shot but I managed to finish my entire drink without getting tomato red. Drinks here seem to be watered down because I also tried my sisters classic margarita and it didn't taste like it had any alcohol in it! I loved it but she did not. 

The next I come back, I'll be ordering their seared ahi tuna again and I'll be trying their empanadas
Great food and very flavorful ! Pleasant atmosphere with cool decor. Great selections on cocktails especially mojitos
Great Happy Hour! Food is good my favorite thing on the menu are the Jamaican jerk chicken wings. They have so much flavor! The drinks are great and the servers are always friendly!

Love love & love! Welcome to the Bahama Breeze where you are transported to an island and served cocktails out of pineapples. The building is beautiful. Quick tip If it's a beautiful day outside ask to sit on the patio! My server I forget her name but she's the lady with the braids wrapped up, I love her! I have had her as my server about three times and she really is the sweetest thing in the world. She makes this place feel even more cozy! This place also has a really good happy hour! If you're lucky you'll get to see live entertainment! I always get the tacos, fish or coconut shrimp. Get the firecracker shrimp ! Don't get me started on the drinks. I love the Bahama mama, the pain killer and the ultimate pineapple! You will feel like you're not even in Las Vegas but instead a tropical get away. Definitely head here if you're in the area!
We went for happy hour on a Thursday and loved it! The food and drinks were great along with the service.

The live music made the night! I had the jerk chicken pasta with a pitcher of mango Margarita, everything was excellent. The service was fast and very helpful, I have nothing bad to say. Perfect Sunday dinner if you are looking for something different and decently priced.

do not get the non alcoholic Bahama mama! nothing really special here. maybe there happy hour is better. I got the cilantro cream chicken and an order of onion rings. the onion rings were better than the entree. it was an "OK" meal. I had high hopes for this place. even my waiter was rude. but the interior is clean and so are the bathrooms. that's a plus. I wouldn't come here again though. I rather go to cesars buffet.

Late Happy Hour around the fire with apps was just what we needed after a long day of travel, sight seeing and shows. The service was FANTASTIC, the appetizers excellent and the drinks strong. It was a spur of the moment choice that I am happy we made.

I wanted to like this place.  It had a great atmosphere and a good vibe.  We went here because it had a claim that it was "Gluten Free." Something I have to look for because of my wheat allergy so I was excited.

They didn't have a special GF menu which is not a big deal to me because typically the waiter will just fill me in or make his recommendations.  This waiter didn't know much about what foods or sauces had flour.  He didn't really have any enthusiasm to find out and come back and make some recommendations. So I had to McGyver my own meal which typically means I have to eliminate the sauces. I tip very well when waiters really know the foods and can make recommendations or atleast have the eagerness to find out for me. I don't typically eat out and this was going to be a real treat for me.

I ordered scallops in butter sauce and the scallops were burnt and then raw in the middle. When I sent them back, they replaced only the one I ate half of.  I asked for a dinner salad instead and they gave it to me with croutons.  He took it back and picked off the croutons as crumbles were still there. What part of "I can't eat flour don't you understand?"  

I sent back the salad and refused to eat as I swore someone would have spit in my food by now.  And let me tell you, I'm a very passive person when it comes to any problems with my food.  So I wasn't mad or anything and I didn't give the waiter any attitude. By the way, the waiter never apologized for any inconvenience or was concerned.

There was a huge two parties going on and every staff member kept coming in and out the patio doors fussying over the parties and most people seated were ignored and were very openly upset about the service by stopping random staff members for drink refills and to check on their food.  I was with two other people who swore it tasted nice but I don't know if they were just being polite as literally "utter chaos" was going on around us and we waited 45 minutes for our table when we called in advance for a reservation.

I was treating my friends so I was shocked that I was given a "$10.00 charge" for food that was returned!  I hadn't eaten anything sat and drank myself silly over the ice tea and left more hungry than I came in.  There was absolutely no apology anywhere or from anyone and I couldn't believe the waiter was serious about this charge. So I didn't tip him.  Probably the first time in a really really long time that I haven't tipped a waiter.  Still feeling a bit guilty over it but it was a very bad experience and it wasn't me that night it was everyone else around us too.
You can't beat their late night happy hour!  My friends and I have become regulars.  So good and super cheap!  Nice easy going atmosphere.  The service is pretty slow.  That is the one drawback.

Came here for their happy hour after work on an extremely hot day since they have frozen drinks! Definitely an extensive tropical drink menu which I can definitely appreciate. The passion fruit mango white sangria is awesome! Definitely recommend that! The chicken quesadilla was a bit much for me, but still okay. BUT the beef empanadas were AMAZING! Definitely an interesting crowd depending on what you're looking for. One of the bartenders we had-Jason- was awesome! Super personable and great service!

Want to have FUN? This is THE PLACE in Las Vegas! Great food, atmosphere, and DRINKS! Yum! Pictures tell in all. But you have to experience it to really appreciate how good it really is! Live music on Friday & Saturday's. Great Caribbean background music the rest of the time.

This place has always been a joy to eat at! My favorite dish is the Chicken & Cilantro cream 'a and the best appetizer to choose would be the full order of the Tower Onion Rings! Yum! On this visit they weren't that great :-/ I mean for $9.79 they could have been a hell of a lot better, were basically on the verge of being burnt! Any who the main dishes of the Coconut Shrimp and Chicken dish were amazing! The customer service was just OK this time. Idk they are slippin' just a tad. I will give them another try in a few months from now. Hopefully this was just a fluke!

This was my first time in Vegas, and the first restaurant, and one of the BEST restaurants we attended while on trip. I kept it simple and ordered the quesadillas, my friend had the shrimp which were big and a generous amount. The food was good and flavorful, BUT the drinks were AMAZINGGGGG!! I'm really into the fruity-tooty, frozen and mixed type drinks, and their menu had plenty of options that were right up my alley. Loved it so much, we made it our last stop before we boarded our rescheduled flight back home.

I am a frequent regular of Bahama Breeze and I love this place ! The staff is always so friendly and the food is amazing ! Feels like you are on an island. The coconut shrimp, the seafood chowder & the grilled chicken breast dinner are my favorites. Ask for Jarrod he is so sweet and a great server !!!!!!!!

This place is okay. I love their drinks and the atmosphere is really comfortable. The service is great and very fast. However, I'm not a big fan of the food. I was okay, but not great. If you are looking for something off the strip for a quick meal, then this is a good place to go.

I liked this place. The decor was nice, reminded me of elephant bar for some reason.

We got the coconut shrimp for our appetizer. Good size shrimp with a delicious sauce. A hit of sweetness and a hint of mustard. I'm not fond of mustard but this was an awesome dipping sauce. Truly enhanced the shrimp. 

For dinner, I ordered the lobster/shrimp linguini. Decent amount of lobster but a crapload of shrimp! Every bite had shrimp and that was well worth the 20 dollars! The sauce had the right amount of creaminess to it which was a plus! 

Yes, I'd go here again. YES YES YES. Especially for the coconut shrimp!

I'm not too sure about this place. I might have to go back and try again. But here's what I am sure about. 

Service - very good, the redeemer of this place. 

Drinks - all of their signature cocktails were just sugar bombs with not of lot of depth. Cheap tasting stuff. 

Food - I got the coconut fried shrimp as a appetizer, and it was really tasty and well done. I ordered the fruit and chicken Caribbean salad and it was ok. The chicken was of the same quality you get in those giant frozen bags at Sams club, and it was just gross, it really felt like fake chicken, like they boiled it, idk. Don't order any of their chicken dishes. The salad was overdressed but was yummy at first. It's a very pretty dish. 

Someone at my table got key lime pie and really like it. 

The prices here are reasonable, if you don't expect above Chili's level cuisine. I will go here again and update this review after trying more of their "signature" dishes. 2 stars for now.

Food is great but customer service is terrible here. I am regular customer and call in phone orders weekly. This week I tried to pay over the phone with my card because I left my purse at the office, and they refused to take payment this way. I have done in the past regularly but Dan the general manager says they no longer take credit cards via phone- which apparently changed from the week before. When I told them I was a regular customer and this has never been issue before Dan didn't have the courtesy to come out from back to speak to me in person. When they took my payment because I had my assistant bring my purse they didn't even look at ID- Hello what's the difference? Although I like there food not sure I would go back since experience was so bad.
I loved everything about this place! The food was great and the service was even better! Thanks Tamika!!! You made our dinner a great experience!!

So we were looking for a place to eat Caribbean food at Vegas and found this place... Just out of this world!!! The food, the ambient, everything is amazing!!! You have to try the coconut shrimp, margaritas, and mojitos. I had the Carnitas rice bowl, it is a blend of all caribbean flavors... A party in your mouth!!! At the end we had the banana nut bread dessert, it is amazing!!! Try it!!!

I don't even live in Vegas but every time I'm here I have to hit this place for Mojito's!! its a great place to have happy hour before heading out for Dinner... I haven't eaten there.. I only get Drinks.... shots of tequilla and mojito's  ( a deadly combo i know ) ... maybe next time I'll actually try the food..

We absolutly LOVED this restaurant!! From the beef empanadas, to the baby back ribs, buttermilk fried chicken, seafood paella, and the chocolate island  chocolate mousse!!!! 
Yummmmmmmmmm we are definetly going back

First time here! Our waiter Jerry was awesome! He can tell you about every item and drink on the menu! I had empanadas as a starter, followed by jerk chicken pasta and a Caesar salad. Also there drinks are so good and happy hour is from 9pm to close!

We had taken a drive to get to know the area and to wander for an early dinner. We found Bahama Breeze and after a warm welcome, a peek at the menu and a 3 minute wait we were seated and ready to go.
Christine B. Gave a great fun evening- humor, promptness, very helpful explanations about the meals and drinks.
I had the mango caipirosca drink with vodka and mango, the sriracha fish tacos with tomato salad ( light meal so I can protect my dear spouse from anentire key lime pie slice) and he had a great shrimp rice bowl. Delicious!!! Big portions.
The pie was excellent and almost tart enough to be killer- with a perfect crust.
The service was individualized and professional.
You know if my tough reviewer husband wants to come back, this was seriously very good!!
I have my next assignment: stuffed plantain with crab on top!!
One tip for management: we were both stunned to see that waitresses must bus their own tables. Now the plates and bowls here are large and very heavy stoneware. This is wear and tear on your very important team. We are hopeful that our concerns reach the ears of big cheeses. Maybe an undercover boss is needed- I can see no CEO working anywhere near as hard as did the staff tonight.
Docking one CEO a star for a really dumb move.

This place to me is like gold in a pile of rubble. 
I always pass this place and never thought of going in, however my sister dragged me here and I'm glad she did!
The architecture is nicely done and reflects buildings found in tropical areas so well that i felt like i was back in Hawaii. 

There is also a water feature that is in the center of the restaurant, and a bridge takes you over it to the various dining places. 

We came during happy hour and got a the lobster shrimp quesadillas, skillet simmered jerk shrimp, fried chicken sliders, ultimate pina colada, and a frozen bahamarita.

I was really disappointed in the Skillet Simmered Jerk Shrimp and felt a little steered wrong by the menu. I was expecting it to have a lot of seasoning and flavor, however it was just normal shrimp scampi. The lobster shrimp and fried chicken sliders were amazing though and made up for the shrimp scampi.

First time here my first experience was not so bad the food was great the service was decent and the price was a little out my budget but it was to be expected hey we're in Vegas gotta live it up!!!! #heyyyyy  I had a mudslide yummy yummy yummylicious lol #heyyyyy #turnup #girlsweekendout #05242014

the service was good at the bar and the waiter was helpful through a lot of questions by the group. I had the crab and avocado salad. It was very flavorful and enjoyable. very fresh, great option for a menu. it was a bit on the pricey side for the portion, but I wouldn't want the quality to be any less. the pumpkin seeds were a great add to the dish. everyone's food looked appetizing in the group and the drinks were also enjoyed by those having alcohol. we also had one person order the jalapeño mojito and the spice was overpowering. they did the right thing and took it back, making a new drink.

Went there for a drink during happy hour and sat at the bar.  We ordered 1/2 price apps and $5 margaritas until we couldn't possibly eat any more.  The portions were huge.  I will say the Margaritas and mojitos were a tad on the strong side, but I prefer them that way.  The bartenders were fun and the atmosphere overall was easy going and fun.  It's the kind of place that melts the stress away.
Good food here and also I really love drinks here to and The Restaurant design look like garden that make you enjoy and relaxing here. And so many parking at the front of restaurant too.

This place has great happy hour specials! Plus they start at 9pm which is earlier than most places in town. 

The appetizers were all really good and the selection of drinks is pretty extensive. 

My only complaint would be the drinks are more sugary than strong. I need a little more liquor! But I still come here pretty often. 

I would definitely recommend checking this place out.

Ahhhh their happy hour is amazing!!! My boyfriend and I usually go for the late night happy hour because it starts at 9pm Sun-Fri. The app specials are delicious and the drink specials are great. We're both able to get pretty drunk for under $50. I also love how the place looks. It has a very tropical theme!

Came here for my mother's birthday. We all regret it, especially mom. Mostly because the extremely slow and at times irritating service. Our waitress was obviously not having a good day, and she made sure we knew it with constant eye rolls and poor excuses for the delays. The drinks we ordered took forever to arrive, and after being there for 2 hours, I only managed to order 2 drinks. I would've happily had another but service left me without a drink for about a 45 minute increment. Spent over $100, wasn't treated like it however. The food was ok, but not worth the subpar service. Will not return.
Jerk wing and lobster quesadillas is a must always hot and fresh.Waiter was friendly and service was quick

We go here a couple times per month and we love their Red beer. Great happy hour prices on drinks. They need to update their menu. Food for happy hour is just so so. Staff is nice but hostess' good use some training. Nice patio when its not too hot to sit outside. They have a great Caribbean theme but needs some updating.

While service and the waiter were very friendly and helpful the food was subpar. We just came from the islands and I have to say Bahama Breeze was a total fail. They fried and breaded my wife's lobster and my shrimp  was not very fresh I hardly could even taste the coconut it was stale or old. While the please has the Island vibes it fails to deliver on the food . Sure presentation is well thought but flavor leave a lot to be desired. It's just not comparable.

Very nice place. very delicious food. but no traditional cuisine. This is a common food for Americans. Fried shrimp...., it's too simple American menu. the Cuban menu or the Caribbean. This kitchen has a different meal choices. But if you're not a gourmet Caribbean cuisine. This restaurant quite a come down.

Las Vegas Carribean TREASURE! Love love this place. We always start with the Fire-Roasted Jerk Shrimp... AAMAZING! It has all the perfect ingredients you can taste. The shrimps are sitting in a pool of this tangy buttery sauce- garlic, tomatoes,thyme.. the sauce is so great you want to drink it but don't go for the spoon just yet, they bring out this warm cuban bread for dunking!... mmm!

Another favorite is the Jamaican Grilled Wings, they are slow roasted to get the skin crispy, but once you bite into them you will taste the tender chicken they pair them with spicy jerk sauce (which you will most likely want your own for dunking)

Drink favorite- Frozen Bahamarita! sweet, tangy and freshing.

This is a must try when in VEGAS! Enjoy!

First time eating at a BB. Food was okay but I think under par for the price the demand. The best thing we had were the Beef Empanadas. otherwise, it was just Meh. Would I go back? Yes, if I was given a gift card. Otherwise, there are too many other great places in Vegas for a lower price point that deliver better food.

This place gets 2 stars for their drinks and appetizers. Every hot dish we ordered came to the table at room temperature, at best. The only item that arrived hot was the empanadas. We also ordered the stuffed plantain and it was super salty. Sadly we won't be returning.

Eh the place is alright nothing to exciting . I had some jerk wings and I was expecting more spice to them and got nothing it was pretty disappointing . Drinks where okay . I was surprised that had a dark beer as a happy hour . The only good thing was our server Randy was amazing very knowledgeable . If I ever come back I'll  come back because of Randy .
Family atmosphere. The food was amazing. The customer service was impeccable. I can't wait to return!!!

When on the fence as a rating for lunch, after much deliberation I am using a 3.. Pros and Cons... apps had two chips salsa and empenadas. Salsa on point as well as empenadas main course was a letdown. Jerk chicken left me wanting but not in a good way.  I wanted something else... Shrimp and lobster quesadillas can lay off all the spinach or rename it ....Jerk Chicken pasta should have been ordered without the asparagus... it gives and unwanted flavor...soups chicken tortilla and the bahamian seafood chowder needed some umph... now the firecracker shrimp adds back to the positives..all in all I was confused, was this a island themed or southwestern themed menu too many items take away from that island theme...I can Pass on a future visit...
Such a great place for happy hour. Ask for Taylor, she was the best! Jamaican chicken and firecracker shrimp

We went there for a wedding rehearsal dinner. So from the top, it was a very large group. We were also very spread out. 
The building was laid out nice with nice decorations. Our table was pretty good. The bench cushions were  a little low for some of the older people in the group but our waitress was really nice and accommodating.  For such a large group, she did amazing. She got the orders right and was very attentive. 

I ordered the firecracker shrimp to start. It was so good. Seasoning was off the hook. Large serving for an appetizer. My beer was nice and cold also.  

I then ordered the fish tacos. I have been a little spoiled living in California I suppose. The tacos were okay. Not enough pop and flavor for me. I was looking for that citrus pop of freshness but it wasn't there. The tortillas were a little chewy. Food alone would have gotten them a three, but when you throw in the awesome service, you can't beat it. The waitress made a fresh pot of coffee for us and the DJ gave my daughter  a Bahama breeze pen.  Everyone loved their food and there were no complaints. Decent price for what you get. 
I would go back easily.

The seafood chowder has one of my favorite elements - conch! Reminds me of the Carribean. The ultimate pina colada is DELICIOUS but low on the alcohol content. Tasty nonetheless. 

Lots of food for not-that-much-money, compared to the rip-off food options on The Strip. Our waiter even itemized our menu for each person, so we could easily split the bill in our group. Awesome service, good food, definitely coming back here again with friends!

A fun neat place to eat!  Had lunch here and found the food to be tasty and pleasing to the eye. 

Restaurant was clean and wait staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. Restaurant atmosphere is light and fun. A good place to eat. We will be back on a future Trip.

My girlfriends and i came here for hapoy hour it was My first experience here and I loved it. I ordered the beef empanadas, jerk shrimp, firecracker shrimp, pork street tacos, chicken tostones .... I will definitely be coming back.

HAPPY HOURS!! Overload $7 Key Lime Pie margarita is my favorite lol 

My boyfriend and I loved this place the first time we went and every other time after that. We just went yesterday and there was a 45 min wait. Probably the only downfall. But what can we expect if it's so good? We had an AWESOME A-1 server named Tamikah who came to check on us every chance she got! Never forgot to see how we were doing no matter how busy it was! We loved it! Will be continuous customer.

Great ambiance, good drinks, good food, average service, chaotic kitchen. Our local Bahama Breeze closed several years ago so when we were in Las Vegas we dropped in. We love the ambiance, we loved the specialty drinks. We ordered our salad, entree, and desert. We waited about 30 minutes before they finally bought out the entree before the salad. I told them to take the entree back and start over by serving the salad first, then the entree, then the desert. While waiting for we started noticing that all the orders in our area of the restaurant were wrong. The servers were running around like keystone cops trying to correct everyone's orders. We finally got our food and it was delicious. However, they need to organize their kitchen.

Lobster and shrimp pasta was the best pasta I have ever tasted.

The server was knowledgeable about the menu and offered several suggestions. Lemonade was best I have tasted. Portions were too much for me to eat. Enjoyed the rest of it in the morning in the hotel room. Overall awesome experience.  

I visit Vegas for all Mayweather fights so this place is definitely on my short list.
The ribs were burnt but the music outside was cool.. The bartender was very nice. The place is very clean. I lost my id there but overall the place was okau

I brought my husband here for a date and boy did we enjoy ourselves. The waitress was very very helpful and recommended some good ideas for us to try (it was our first time). The place was set up very nice and I love the little scenery they have inside and outside. The food was delicious and served in very generous amounts. I highly recommend you trying the Pineapple-Coconut Martini it's to die for!

Had a great experience at happy hour except for one thing.  The waitress up sold the group into having our piña coladas in hallowed out pineapples.  But she failed to mention it cost $8 more.  Guess caveat emptor right???  But we all felt she should have mentioned the additional cost as we were ordering off the happy hour menu.  Other than that great service and ambiance the apps were all tasty the jerk chicken wings especially phenomenal

Drove by this place a million times... finally decided to come in and check it out. Neat vibe. Great drinks and a wonderful happy hour! Had a frozen bahamita and an ultimate pina colada. Like the colada better. Bartender was Jesse and he was excellent... helped me maneuver through the menu. Very helpful!!! Tried the key lime pie and it was great. Also tried the jerk wings... interesting taste that finished wonderfully. I am a very picky Mac and Cheese guy... so that one did not ring my bell. Will definitely bring back friends and family when they are in town!!!

Love love love this place! I will definitely recommend this place to everyone. The food was excellent and the waiter was great. My pina colada was one of the best I've ever had, I will definitely be back.

Walking into this place gives you a relax feeling of being on the beach. Customer service was real good from our server. Took a little long for our food to come out and it wasn't layered with Apps first then meal. Other than that service was solid. I had the Habanero wings and firecracker shrimp to start and both were delicious. Followed it with the Cuban Sandwich. The sandwich was good but tasted a bit bland for my taste. Once I asked for the extra mustard it was good. I would definitely come back when I am in Vegas. I do recommend you stop by and have try!!

I can't even say how many times I've been here with family, co workers or my boyfriend. Honestly just amazing food with a lot of flavor. Best time to go is any time they have a happy hour that you can't wait to run off to. There special Bahama drink are delicious you will probably order 5 of them from how good they are. The fire shrimp are bomb. And lobster shrimp quesadilla are dam near filled with gooey deliciousness. You won't be sorry you came

I was born and raised in Vegas so whenever I come back to visit I have to come to this place. They need to open up a restaurant in Arizona. My favorite meal is from here and it's a must try, the salmon tostada. The portion is huge, the salmon is perfectly cooked, and the dressing is to die for. Another favorite is the habanero wings, you get a ton of wings since it's an appetizer and the sauce is sweet and spicy. The cocktails are great here and the happy hour deals are wonderful! The service is always great, everyone is so friendly we haven't had a bad server yet. My mom and I come at least every two weeks, sometimes once a week.

After getting a couple of kid free hours to get my son's birthday shopping done I needed a bite to eat. My man suggested Bahama Breeze because he was in the mood for fish. I was just hungry and didn't care so off we went. 

Joanna was our server and she was lovely. I would definitely give her 4 our of 5 stars. We started with the Coconut shrimp (which is my man's favorite). It was good but I don't love it like he does. Something about fried coconut flakes just doesn't do it for me...to each his own. I ordered the lobster/shrimp quesadilla with a bowl of the seafood chowder. My quesadilla was fine but nothing to write home about...it could have used some hot sauce. The soup, however, was phenomenal. It was like a crab/shrimp chowder with little fried shrimp on top. It was creamy, smooth, not too salty and hearty enough. It was rich so I couldn't finish it all. My man was a fan and took the rest home for a late night snack. 

Overall an A-OK experience. I will be back if I think about it.

Bar/drinks review only. Great happy hour prices. I like the Aruba Red (beer) which is only at Bahama Breeze. I haven't had the food in a long time just because I tend to opt for healthier choices at other places, and I can't remember it well enough to write any opinion on it. I love to stop here for a drink from time to time.

Awesome food, excellent customer service.  Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helped me make a great decision.  I enjoyed talking sports with him...even though he is a 49er fan...lol.  Thanks for a wonderful lunch experience!

I came here with my fiancé and had Anita as our waitress...she said was amazing! Funny, engaging, genuinely sweet and knowledgeable!
We tried her recommendations of the lobster quesadillas, jerk chicken pasta, fire cracker shrimp, shrimp and lobster linguini and the ultimate pineapple drink and needless to say when my fiancé and I need a break from La and find ourselves in Vegas we will definitely be back! If you find yourself at Bahama breeze ask for Anita, It'll enhance your experience.

With its close proximity to the university, my classmates and I often swing by for their happy hour that goes from 4-6 pm. (Apparently there is also a reverse happy hour that happens 9-close!) We LOVE it.

With its tropical, breezy, just-sitting-out-on-the-veranda ambience, their specialty drinks are matched to boot. We usually indulge in these $4 perfectly garnished and charming cocktails. Ultimate Pina Colada, Bahamarita, Mojito Cubano, Pineapple Coconut Martini. (I've tried them all except the sangria and margarita on the rocks.) They're so pretty that you'll want to bust out your phone and be that person at the table. You know, *that* person.

If this doesn't suit your fancy, they also offer select beers for $2-$3, wines $2 off, and the standard mixed spirits for $3. 

Appetizers are half-off and are consistent with the quality of their drinks - flavorful, garnished appropriately, infused and influenced with its caribbean namesake. They offer a wide variety, so all mouths are sure to find something to pique their taste buds. The coconut shrimp seems to be a popular choice, but I recommend the beef empanadas, which is what I ordered on a recent visit. 

Round up your friends, relax and take a breather at "Bahama Breeze." Totally worth it.

I am staying at the Residence Inn right behind this establishment.  My roommate and I were hungry but did not want to venture off too far.  We went here and were blown away.  Not only was the service great, thanks to Luis and Jason behind the bar, but the food was AMAZING!  We got there at exactly 9 p.m. and that is when they begin their happy hour.  I had the jumbo crab lump and shrimp tacos, followed by a mojito.  The next evening, I returned.  I had three of their Aruba Red beer and that was delicious.  To eat, I had the jumbo lump crab and the empanadas.  I was not disappointed!  Great place, music, ambience...it has it all.

My wife and I had been to three Bahama Breeze locations: Raleigh, Seattle, and Las Vegas. We  revisited the Las Vegas location yesterday. 

The first thing we order, directly after the drinks, is the beef empanadas. Just as they were at every other location, they are unmatched and delicious! We went at lunch time for the first time at any location hoping to get a variation on the menu. We were pleasantly surprised. We got the lobster quesadilla combo with a caesar salad. The caesar had slightly too much dressing incorporated into the salad, but the amount of lobster and shrimp packed into the quesadillas made up for that minor hiccup. Great food and atmosphere as usual. Special thanks to the host staff at the front who were very hospitable!

Very good food selection and a very laid back atmosphere. Does give the feeling of being in the islands. Prices are in line for the casual atmosphere. The wait staff and hostess are very helpful and pleasant.
LOVE the beachy island vibe here! Live reggae band on saturdays & they aren't just ok, they are amazing!!! The delicious cocktails are just 7.99! We got appetizers & salads, everything was yummy!

Located a little south of the strip but a true hidden gem. The prices were reasonable. We went during lunch. The Cuban sandwich was delicious. The house salad was amazing. My sister recommends the beef empanadas. Coconut shrimp were cooked to perfection. The drinks...they were amazing. Very tropical and fruity and you cannot taste the alcohol. Indoor and patio seating. It was great to be able to enjoy the warm weather. This will be a place we definitely will be coming back to and sharing with our friends.

Cool place to hang out with the family ... Especially if I'm picking up the tab! The place makes you feel like you've escaped to the Caribbean.
Cool thing is they have live reggae music at night.

nice atmosphere but our server wasnt the best at her job. She kept looking at me and asking for my id and my husband had it our drinks were good but took forever food was was excellant ill go back but would like another server who loves her job

This Caribbean restaurant has been a staple at the corner of Flamingo and Paradise forever it seems.  They consistently serve good food.  I really like their jerk chicken pasta and their seafood paella.  But this time, I decided to try something different and ordered their avocado and crab meat salad.  It was so good!  All the ingredients in the salad was very fresh and I got a whole avocado with this salad. They serve the avocado cut in half for me to scoop out myself and mix with the lump crab meat.  This place is quite busy during their lunch hour rush.  Their happy hour between 4 pm to 6 pm rocks with half price appetizers and cheap drinks.  If you like chicken wings, try their Jamaican chicken wings.  Everything I have tried has been tastefully presented and very pleasing to the palate.  If you have never been here before, you must try this place out.  You won't be disappointed as a they have a wide selection of menu items to choose from.  Oh, did I mention their mojitos are to die for!!
Best Jamaican food in town. Forget the overpriced restaurants on the strip. Just go there and enjoy food, drinks, and live music for a fraction of the cost.
Food, service, and prices were perfect! Lindsey was a great bartender. Only thing I didn't like here was the terrible shirts.
This food was beyond good. It took me to my happy place. It was so seasoned and moist. I will be coming here more often.

I've been wanting to try this place ever since I moved here. I finally made it and I wasn't disappointed.
We started with the panko/coconut onion rings, they were really good. Not to greasy and the coconut flakes gave it a nice flavor.
I got the avocado and crab salad. Very very good. I ate every single bite!
No run for dessert, but my two drinks were sweet enough. They were a specialty drink, kinda like a pina colada but without being frozen, very good!
I definately will come back!

I stopped by here with a friend to celebrate National Margarita Day because they had a deal going on where you could get margaritas for $2.22 each. Devin, was our server and he did a great job taking care of us. We started out of course with a margarita and it tasted pretty good, but they weren't consistent tasting each time. The promotion price was deducted from our bill with no problem and I was glad since the drinks were just so-so. 

Grilled Chicken and Tropical Fruit Salad ($12.49) -  Pineapple, red grapes, strawberries and mandarin oranges with goat cheese crumbles, candied almonds and drizzled with Island vinaigrette and grilled chicken. When it came to the chicken I was disappointed because it's described at grilled and the picture of it on the menu shows chicken with grill marks, but mine appeared to be seared instead of grilled and had no flavor at all. The chicken lacking flavor honestly left my mind once I tasted the greens, fruits and dressing underneath because there was a good amount of it and it all melded very well together. Good portion for the price and I'd order it again even if the chicken doesn't live up.

Rebecca's Key Lime Pie ($6.99) - Handmade with a brown sugar crust and golden meringue. I've had this dessert before and it tasted just as good this last visit. It's my favorite on the menu and tastes just right. Love that crust.  

Warm Chocolate Pineapple Upside-Down Cake ($6.99) - Warm chocolate cake with a chocolate molten center topped with caramelized pineapple and served with raspberry sauce and fresh Island fruit. The first bite tasted a bit like burnt chocolate, but once I got towards the center it was chocolate heaven. 

Inside was clean and they have plenty of dining space as well an outdoor patio. 

Happy Hour is Monday - Friday 4:00 PM - 6:00 P.M.

Late night Happy Hour is Sunday - Thursday 9:00 PM - Close.

Service was great, and food was tastefully prepared and served timely.
Our server was Neil and he was very informative and attentive to our needs.  The drinks were great too.

You better get really drunk because the food is horrible.   This our 3rd and last try at this place. We ordered conch fritters.just ok.  Chicken empenadas that were wet inside and doughy..disgusting taste. Sent it back for chicken curry rice bowl.  It was a small amount overall with about 5 small chunks of chicken. .the flavor was so so but after biting into a piece of chicken fat,and gristle that did it.  My guest ordered mahi tacos..it was,and griffin thin sliver of dried fish..looked like jerky more than fish.  Tge visit before we had a chicken pasta dish that was like a parmesan soup...Truly a terrible cooking.  We had a gift card which had money on it after we paid the bill...we gave it to another table as we won't be going back.  That's how bad it was.  Being locals..they must be staying in biz off drinks and tourists.

Love this place! Hot flavorful food, great happy hour, and from the moment we walked in the staff made us feel welcome! Gerry our server hit the spot. He was attentive, and outgoing. Jerk wings and shrimp n grits are a must try!
Mojito and new Major Lazor cocktail had a great kick. Atmosphere is a lively island feel. Best bang for your buck! Highly recommended

I came here for happy hour around 4:30pm on a Friday. My server Alexis was great! Very kind and friendly. I ordered the Frozen Bahamita and Jerk Chicken. Both were so good. I would highly recommend trying this place out when your in Las Vegas.

The portions are so huge for a happy Hour menu and they are half off. The drinks are only $4.. I ordered the Skillet Simmered Jerk Shrimp -  large  shrimp in a garlic-thyme butter with warm Cuban bread for dipping. It was good and I wanted to get more but found out the portion was big enough for me. I had the frozen Bahamarita that has 
Cuervo Gold Tequila, strawberry, kiwi and mango ices. My friends liked their food too. Richard our server was great, very attentive and made sure we were good. The place has a tropical feel and very airy, spacious. It is great for parties and you get tables for happy hour menu, it's not only at the bar.
I don't know if this is always 5star, but it was tonight.   Great top shelf marg for the price (especially in vegas) and excellently prepared salmon salad.

Nice place! Christine B was an amazing server. I will return. If you want to come for a nice casual dining experience with great drinks, you should come here. The food is served at a decent pace, it come out nice and fresh and they make sure to keep you satisfied. I loved my server and the food was great.

Bahama Breeze is a fun place to eat!  We came here around 7p on NYE before we walked the strip.  I was surprised we were able to get a reservation for 10, but it seemed like 7p was a bit early.

The food is pretty good, and for the price you can't really beat it.  I know that Vegas has all sorts of buffets, but there is something somewhat sad about buffets; most people concentrate on eating.  The ambience is great despite the somewhat tacky props and decor.

I'd imagine I'd give this more of a 3.5, but since they were so accomodating about adding another table (to make 10 from 8) and since I had such a good time (it being NYE), why the heck not, 4 stars for everyone!

Love this place, nice ambience, has live music playing on the outside patio. Love the Jamaican jerk wings. The Cuban sandwiches are amazing. Everything I've tried here so far was really good. Just wish this place wasn't so far away.

My family and I were staying in Vegas for the week and we decided to have my aunts birthday there. This place is hands down amazing! Great selection, cheap drinks and the best service I've had in years!!! The burgers, pasta, and banana supreme is Delicious.  Gerald and Tina were our waiter's. We will definitely be coming back. They also came out with writing on my aunts desert for her bday

Staff is super friendly! It's definitely a throw back to the 90s when these big themed family restaurants were all the rage. Along with mom jeans.

For portions were massive! So definitely a good deal.
I got steak with plantains and beans. Flavors were great but my steak was kinda cold. My husband got a cream cilantro chicken dish that was absolutely yummy.

Dessert was molten chocolate cake with pineapple. It was good but nothing really outstanding about it.

They also offer happy hour and late happy hour. I'd recommend catching those. Their appetizer options are all half off which makes that lobster quesadilla only $7 yum!

By far this has been one of our favorite places to eat and drink in Vegas.  We come to town about 3-4 times a year for a extended weekend, and Bahama Breeze has always been our most anticipated stops.
Something went astray this time.  I ordered my usual ( Cuban Black Bean Soup, and Jerk Chicken Wings), my wife ordered the Portabella Mushroom Burger.  When he explained it was a hamburger, with a mushroom on top, my wife requested just a "burger" made with the Portabella mushroom as the burger.  I guess the special request was just to complicated.  First she got a open faced bun with a mushroom and veggie mix on it.  She requested the same thing again, and this time it came out as she requested, at about the start of the second bite, a small black bug crawled out from under the lettuce and casually walked across the corner of her sandwitch.  We called the waiter, pointed out the intruder, and he promptly took it back.
He then asked us if we wanted any desert.  We didn't quite understand the question, so we said no.  He brought us our bill.  
We didn't understand.  My wife had had nothing to eat at this point.  We didn't ask for anything else we just thought he would replace her un-eaten sandwich. 
The manager did come over and apologize, and told us how sorry he was, but her sandwich was not replaced.  
As we were leaving, I told the hostess the story, she hailed the manager who apologized again, but didn't seem to understand when I explained that my wife was leaving your establishment Hungary.  People shouldn't leave a restaurant Hungary.  
Not sure if we will try again, just kinda sad that our favorite place, now has a scar.

I am trying to like this place but twice I am asked to wait 15 minutes for a table when the restaurant isn't busy and there's no one waiting in front of me. After waiting they tried to sit me in the large dining area where no one was sitting. I traveling for work and dining alone so I think they are trying to force me to eat at the bar. 

My first visit was mediocre. I ordered a beer which came to me in a bottle that a runner just dropped on the table and ran away. The beer was warm inside but the bottle was cold and the label was about ready to fall off. I guessed they tried to ice down  a room temperature beer. The waiter at least offered a glass for my beer.

I ordered the grilled chicken with cilantro cream. The chicken didn't have much taste since it seemed to be grilled then some bland glaze added on top. There was a bed of mash potatoes that was smothered in a  green 'cilantro' sauce which I liked but I'm a sucker for any thing smothered in gravy. 

So overall I would go back here but I don't expect great good. It's is reasonably price but nothing special.  If you go during happy hour you can make out like a bandit with half price apps and drinks for dinner. Happy hour is 9pm to midnight.

Had a retirement party for a friend, 20-25 people were there, they shoved us in a small room with the fire pit in the center, some ppl had to stand due to the lack of chairs and tables, the service was absolutely terrible, very slow, some ppl had to go to the bar for their own drinks. My drink was basically a slushy with shot of tequila on the side , I had to drink some of the slush in order to get the tequila to fit in the glass .. Knowing how many ppl were there they only had two servers and one bus boy .. You could tell the girls were over whelmed and it showed in their service and attitude.. Some of the appetizers were bland , such as the spinach artichoke like dip was extremely watery and had ZERO flavor, the smoked wings were tough , the only good thing were the coconut shrimp.. I use like eating there , but after this , I probably won't return .. Party or not !!

I had the "fresh fish" salmon with mashed potatoes & asparagus. 

Was actually better than I expected, no fishy taste and the potatoes were very tasty. They should be with all the butter they add. 

Excellent meal if you're not looking for something heavy.


Now about the SERVICE. 

- We sat at the bar and were greeted with an obnoxious bartender. 
- When asking for water he just had to say "so you just want good ole lake mead?" Tackiest way to try and upsell. I wish he would try that at a fine dining establishment. 
- He tried to memorize our two simple order and of course he messed up. Use a pen and paper next time.
- forgot to put in our appetizer & never realized it.

The guy definitely had a few drinks before work. 

If I ever return I'll grab a table.

FYI I love lake mead water.

It's a fun hang-out, as long as your expectations are managed.  It's basically TGIFridays or Applebee's, but with a more exotic menu.  The service is hit or miss. But if you just want a bite after work and you are nearby, you could do worse.  Stick to the basics, and don't be too adventurous, and you'll be alright.
The staff is really polite (5 stars) and the food is OK (2 stars.) I went with 4 because food is more important. The drinks are good if you're looking for tropical stuff (duh.)

We love this place! Food is always great, especially the shrimp firecracker, staff is friendly and the atmosphere makes you feel like you're not in Vegas anymore. Their alcoholic drinks are always awesome! I definitely recommend this spot especially lunch time on a Sunday afternoon! Just relaxing to sit in the patio with a drink in your hand and great food in front of you!
Good vibes. Great food. Phenomenal service. Counch fritters x Reggae Punch for the win!

Great food and a great happy hour menu! Perfect for 104 degree weather!!! Their bahamarita is the perfect frozen drink and their sangria get a two thumbs up!!!! Happy hour is the best time to come and get the best bang for your buck!! And the crowd is pretty great!

BBQ ribs were pretty tasty.

Also the mens bathroom by the bar smelled like trix cereal. I was oddly satisfied.

For a Bahamian off strip restaurant we had a great lunch at Bahamas breeze . 

Service : Service was attentive and good . 

Food: we had a bunch of plates for two people. We started with the tostones which were great but very filling . We also tried the seafood chowder which was very good but very creamy . I had the shrimp and cheesy grist which were good and loaded with calories . We also added plantains and a side of beans . 

Drinks : drinks were amazing and one of the reason we will be back . We had the coconut mojito which was amazing and also a margarita which was pretty standard . 

Overall experience : The patio is a great place for a lunch and is enclosed to keep out the heat of the desert . We will definitely be back for a lunch in the future .
Food was good, Beef empanadas were fabulous with the pineapple chutney. I like the Caribbean decor, makes me want a vacation away from this desert scenery.
Love coming here for there happy hour every week. It has great appetizers. I highly recommend the beef empanadas, so good.

Awesome appetizers and awesome desserts!
 Unfortunately, I have been three times and cannot, for the life of me, seem to remember a single entree. Must have appetizers  are as follows: West indies Beef patties, fire roasted jerk shrimp, crab claws st. thomas, island onion rings,  jamaican jerk wings.

The food was just ok.  Had a salad and onion rings.......we did order spinach dip for the group and that was solid. 

Service was really bad tho........our server was too busy paying attention to others.......he screwed up a few times.....but the big one was when I told him no cucumber since I am allergic.

Paella was super flavorful and filled with substantial amount of seafood. Was way too much but our waitress quickly boxed it up for us without having to ask for it!  My husband had chicken kabob and he lived it. Love the ambience and lively Caribbean music. Our servers were attentive and on top of all our extra requests. Only advice for 5 star rating is up front hostess needs people skills. She's not well trained OR she needs to be reassigned to different position where she doesn't get overwhelmed with minute issues!  Chocolate upside down cake was amazing!!!!

My girlfriend and I stopped here for drinks yesterday. The bar staff was super friendly and we got our drinks quick. The first round was very strong but the second round tasted extremely watered down. Everything we ordered had the same Dark Rum in it so I'm not sure how the taste differed so much. When I told the bartender we were ready for the check he acknowledged my request then ignored us for at least 10 mins. I finally had to ask another staff member for the check.

Ok so I had to "live in Vegas" for a couple weeks while working on a Casino and my "home" ended up right across the street from this place. Which in case you were not aware, is apparently in a bad neighborhood. I was warned by 1) the cab driver dropping me off from the airport 2) a co-worker and 3) another cabby taking me home from work--that I should never walk alone after 5pm.
