The menu looked pretty good, so I was excited to try this place. The service was so slow. We were seated immediately and then ignored for like 20 min. then our order taken and then ignored for 30 min, we asked what was up and they had made the order wrong, but no one told us. Finally after being in the restaurant for about an hour and a half we got our food. It was okay, but definitely not worth the wait. It was the type of chain like food one would expect from a Chili's or TGIF and they got the order wrong. We talked to the manager and he did not seem to care. Moral of my story--this place is no breeze.

We love going here! The Jerk Chicken Pasta is to DIE for... 

Anyone who goes needs to try it out!

Our server's name was Lindsay. She had a smile very unique to her. Warm and calming. She lightened up the entire establishment with her kind smile. She was very attentive and gave us our space at the same time. A quality and skill that not too many servers possess. 
Although I don't remember the manager's name, he provided helpful suggestions to wonderful food and ways to prepare it which were not all on the menu. He personally checked back with us later and offered other options... Including wonderful desserts.

Came here with a group for a gathering.  Sat in the enclosed patio and the service was fantastic. Jason and Brandon worked hard to ensure all of our needs were met.  Some friends and I took advantage of the happy hour menu.  I agree with all of the reviewers that the coconut shrimp is amazing!  The Jamaican jerk chicken wings were also awesome.  I'd also recommend the empanadas that were such amazing comfort food!  The $3.21 cocktails for their birthday wee great as well!  All in all I'd recommend this place!
Happy Hour is the best time to go! The beef empanadas and coconut shrimp is flavorful.  The ultimate pina colada is refreshing.  The warm chocolate pineapple upside down cake is to die for.

It's like a TGIF type deal w/ tasteless generic food w/ some "islandy" decorations. There's no real carribean taste and no dishes that stand out. Two things to try though, are the tostones w/ chicken which is like plaintain nachos, the plaintains are deepfried twice and the blended island margarita.

Took mom for her 77th birthday. Never again.. It took 15 for the servers to figure out who's table was who's. We ordered drinks. Then food. They brought our drinks with our food. It took 25 minutes to get our Drinks.. Are you serious. We were in deep family conversation so it took us a while to realize they totally forgot our appetizers. Worst part ever after I told the server it was my moms birthday they NEVER brought anything out to sing her happy birthday. I spent over $100. For crap service. Very upset only thing manager did was offer to give her a dessert to go. Really you guys ruined her birthday party. You guys should be embarrassed. I attempted to call Corporate and never got a response. Kudos

I have been here many times and had one very bad experience. I spoke with Dan the manager and he assured me it wouldn't happen again. We went back last week and Brandon was our waiter. I must say he was awesome. Drinks and food all came in a timely manner and he checked on us many times. This is what I'm used to getting at Bahama Breeze. 
I highly recommend this place.  I will be back. Thank you Dan and Brandon.

I love the Habanero Wings. If you are a wing lover like me Bahama Breeze provides a unique spin that you won't find anywhere else. The wings were all a good size and it's served with a nice flavored sour cream that perfectly complements the flavor of the wings and balanced the spice of the Habanero.  My server Devin was also very friendly and attentive.  I had a great experience.

My wife and I have dined here a few times and thought we had found another favorite. 
The Habanero wings are good. The Key Lime pie is very authentic. However when we decided to go there for my wife's birthday we were extremely disappointed. I ordered Jerk Chicken. I ate about half of the chicken when I realized it was getting difficult to pull the meat from the bone. This generally means chicken is undercooked. When I showed our server he called over the manager who insisted she have it remade for us. I told her I didn't really want a remake. So I opted for it to go. I was really disappointed when I told them it was my wife's birthday and ordered Key Lime pie expecting they would make her feel important with some sort of Birthday thing. But what we got was a waiter who said " pretend I sang for you and then you blew out a birthday candle then walked away. 
I will never go back to Bahama Breeze nor do I recommend them to anyone else. I can see now why they were not busy near the strip on Friday night. Diners Beware!!!

Their happy hour is the best!

You don't have to sit by the bar or at a particular area of the restaurant to get their happy hour specials, which is a huge bonus!  Happy hour is from 4-6 pm Monday - Friday.  Their prices are outstanding, and the service is awesome!  Drinks are strong and the food is tasty!
I love be the patio here!! Great service, very polite and attentive. They have a Jamaican hot sauce to die for and a great happy hour.

We came for late night happy hour.  We had two shrimp dishes.   They were excellent.  The service was great.  Good casual ambiance.  Lindsey was our waitress.  Lindsey did an excellent job.  Thank you!

A friend of mine hosted a business dinner here and invited me to join them.  It's been a while since I've visited this joint, so I gladly accepted.  When I arrived, they were already seated and the Appetizers were coming out.  They ordered Coconut Shrimp (Crispy large Shrimp hand-breaded with sweet flaky Coconut & a Citrus-Mustard dipping Sauce) & Creole Baked Goat Cheese (In roasted Red Bell Peppers served with vine-ripened Tomato Salsa and Parmesan Toast).

The Coconut Shrimp was OK, not great.  They're large sized Shrimp.....the Coconut Breading was a bit sweet for my tastes.  The Creole Baked Goat Cheese was excellent!  If you try the Goat Cheese, you have to slice up the Bell Pepper and eat it....it was amazingly good.

For an entree, I ordered the Jerk Chicken Pasta (Jerk Chicken Breast, fresh Asparagus and Mushrooms tossed in a rich Parmesan-Herb Cream Sauce with Bow-Tie Pasta).  They weren't kidding when they said this dish was "rich".....I think I gained 5 lbs after eating this thing.....it was very good though.  Despite being rich, the Sauce didn't overwhelm the dish and it had a nice flavor.  The Jerk Chicken was cooked perfectly and was of good quality.....you could taste the flavor that Jerk Chicken is known for....I was left wanting more.  Thank God it wasn't bottomless, otherwise I'd have to buy new clothes afterwards....ha!

Overall, it was good service and good food.  This place is a solid 4 Stars.

Return Factor - 82%

I came in here with one of my co-workers for their late night happy hour. Their appetizers are half off during happy hour and the portions are what make it worth your while. 

I got the crispy onion rings, the lobster & shrimp quesadilla, and the Jamaican chicken wings. For a drink, I just stuck with the coconut water.

The crispy onion rings have a panko-coconut breading that's fried to a golden-brown. The coconut flavor is really subtle, but you can't go wrong with this classic appetizer.

The lobster & shrimp quesadilla was pretty amazing. Who would've ever thought that cheese and shellfish would be a perfect match? They came with pico de gallo and sour cream on the side, which go perfect with these little triangles of cheesy goodness. The lobster seemed a little sparing, but the shrimp was definitely there.

The Jamaican chicken wings had the perfect marinade to it. The jerk spices added a unique zing to the wings that blast your tastebuds with rich flavor! The spiciness factor isn't too hot. It won't burn your tongue, but it definitely has a noticeable kick. 

I'll be back to try their entrees, but their appetizers are really something special. Any place that has amazing deals for their happy hour is worth it to me!
Was in town and stopped here for lunch. Good food, clean, great service.
The food was alright I had a burger however I had better. The drinks were pretty good I have to say. That's the only reason I'm giving them 3stars the drinks

Though I am neither a big Caribbean food buff nor a Caribbean food connoisseur, I am proud to say that Bahama Breeze has hit all my five-star-diamond standard. 

The food is absolutely fantastic, and the service is excellent. It is a fairly good-sized restaurant, yet the food and the service are delivered at the great speed. 

Unfortunately, I'm not quite cool with the seafood. (I get allergic to seafood from time to time.) I did taste my friends' seafood dishes for a bite, and they were yummy. I personally liked to order BBQ Ribs and Pork Tenderloin. Great choices though.

Driven by the joint for years, finally stopped in. Was pleasantly surprised by large drink and food menu. Very friendly wait staff. Was Reggae Fest wth live music, guitar player/singer and his computer-track band.
Great quality food, customer service, and atmosphere. This restaurant feels like you are on an island somewhere- nice escape.

Some of the best jerk chicken west of da Islands painkillers are a great tease also when in Sin City this is my first stop gotta make happy hour for more fun so many great choices gonna visit tomorrow night also love bringing new people here they are pleasantly surprised a little taste of the virgin islands and Jamaica  you can't pass this gem while in Las Vegas

I ate here for the first time the other day, and I have 0 complaints! I was a little skeptical because I've never eaten at a Caribbean restaurant before but the food here is so so good!!! The waitress that we had was amazing as well, she was so funny and genuine. I would definitely recommend this place, and I can't wait to eat here again!

Restaurant seemed mostly empty. Was given a pager and was told no more than 10 minutes to wait. 20 mins later i was seated. Waiter was very friendly, but a little too sparky for me. Took a half an hour to take our dinner order. Have been here over an hour and still haven't gotten my food yet. Wait. Just came. How am I supposed to eat this whole burger with this little bitty cup of ketchup? Smh. My daughter ordered her burger medium well. It was burnt to a crisp. Food over all was bleh.  Service was friendly, but horrible.

From the outside, Bahama Breeze looks like a franchise restaurant that should've been closed in the 90s. But, their happy hour is something worth checking out. From 4:00-6:00 pm, a 20 oz. draft beer is only $3! The firecracker shrimp street tacos (3) were my favorite and half off as were the rest of the appetizers. The habanero chicken wings weren't that spicy, but you get at least a dozen wings. The lobster and shrimp quesadilla was a bit lackluster. Otherwise, great happy hour find!
Outdoor seating feels like your in Key West. Good, solid Caribbean food, happy hour starts again at 9:00, reasonable prices, good drinks.

Listen.  When you have a group of 18 to 21 people it can never be easy.  I'm sure the wait staff do not enjoy.  Plus issuing separate checks and keeping it all organized this cannot be an easy task.  Saturday night we were there and it was a very large party.  Jerry and I cannot remember the gals name kept up with us all night.  Very accommodating.  Very courteous.  Very attentive.  It was nice.  The food is ok.  It can cater to a lot of different tastes.  Pasta to steak to hummus and nachos.  Drinks were good.  It can get loud but we've obviously made it one of our stops each time we come into Vegas.  We always have a large crowd when we do our annual trip and this place just gets it.  

Thank you BB.

Came here for my friends birthday party and the happy hour menu was amazing!!!!! OMG sooo much drinks and appetizers for such a low cost. 

You have to try the Ultimate piña Colada. If you like sweet drinks then... Please do yourself a favor and order one lol happy price is only $4.

Not very welcoming. For got my drinks twice luckily I had water in my diaper bag.

Didn't seem like they wanted to help us. Christina was our server. No one got refills and we couldn't even ask because she wasn't around. People that served our food didn't seem like they wanted to work. 

Food looked AMAZING just like the pictures. 

I got a salmon salad and it had to much dressing. 

Spoke to the manager very professional he said sorry still left a tip wish I hadn't service was horrible

Heading out of Vegas after a nice weekend we wanted to grab a bite to eat off of the strip. It's my job to choose our restaurants so as we drove by Bahama Breeze something made me say say "stop, turn here!" I'm glad we did.  It's your typical chain restaurant with oversized booths and waiters in tropical shirts, but we were both pleased with our meals and our friendly waiter. We had the beef empenada appetizer, the chicken kabob over yellow rice and the fresh jerk salmon of the day. The food was seasoned well and the menu has plenty to choose from without being overwhelming. 

The food was reasonably priced for lunch and the portions were great, not too much food it was perfect. Our waiter was so sweet and even gave us a tip on a great place to go shopping! The tropical drinks looked great, so next time I visit I would like to try one.  It was a nice relaxing comforting lunch to end our fun trip in Vegas.

When will you put a Bahama Breeze in SOCAL? I love this place! The appetizer cajon shrimp platter with bread is the best thing I've ever tasted.  I have been writing letters to the company to expand westward for years, but no feedback and no outcome :( BEST FOOD EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Best decision we made coming here tonight was leaving our booth to dine at the bar and I am so glad we did! We had the BEST service from Russell & Evann. No exaggeration - these two fellas were on top of it!!! Plenty of conversation & lots of suggestions of cool things to do during our stay.

Now about the food .... WOW! Everything tasted fresh & amazing. Our appetizers were like entrees they were so big! We loved the seared sesame crusted Ahi, coconut shrimp & chicken quesadillas. If we didn't come hungry & ready to pack in some grub the appetizers would have been enough because we also had cocktails. But we also ordered bowls! The plantain bowl was my favorite!!!! sweet & salty all in one dish and I was able to substitute the ground beef for jackfruit #Vegetarian. 

This may become a regular stop whenever we visit Vegas! But ONLY if we post up at the bar - the service in regular dining started off suspect & unimpressive LOL

Went here for lunch today after a long day at the Convention Center for the builder's show.  It's approximately two miles away and conveniently located on Paradise and Flamingo.  You walk in and definitely get the vibe of being in the Bahamas.  Fresh water flowing, tropical decor everywhere and many choices of rum mixed drinks with flavors that bring you back to paradise at sea.

Items Ordered:
- Firecracker Shrimp (Appetizer)
- Jerk Chicken Fettucini (Entree)

My initial appetizer was quite good and I'm not sure what the sauce was made from, but it was very flavorful.  Was definitely in the caliber for bang bang shrimp from Bonefish Grill.  The jerk chicken Fettucini definitely had a nice kick after each bite and made my taste buds crave more.  The portions for both entree and appetizer were extremely generous and I'm so glad I split my meal with my wife.  I really wanted to try the pineapple mixed drink, but unfortunately I was in working hours.  I'd definitely like to come back for happy hour and try other items on the menu.

this is a cool place. . i went the people that were there for the wedding the food was good i liked the pasta ordered .  the survuce was fast  and they seated our large groups quickly. they had a good tropical look. like i said in a bast review i would not have gone there if i was by myself. i wanted to do stuff more unique to Vegas
I love the Calypso Pasta with shrimp so much, that I learned to make it myself. West Indies Patties are soo good as well.

Tasty overall! Came for lunch. Sister had the habanero wings and the jerk shrimp, very good! Daughter had the chicken tenders, mediocre. I had the chicken curry over rice with naan. The naan, eh, nothing special. The coconit curry sauce and rice very flavorful and decent amount of spice. Chicken was over cooked and hard. Service was just ok.
Food was pretty good. Our waitress Sandra was great.  They were missing some of the items on the menu. Overall a good experience.

I attended a group event here. The food and service were exceptional! The staff was attentive to all of our needs.  I would recommend this restaurant for group or individual dining!  Their coconut shrimp is the best I've had!

overall pretty good.. applewood bacon & cheddar burger was so bomb.. 

they use fresh ground beef so don't be scared 2 order it a little red if u like it that way...

service was fast and always attentive..

Overall not too bad.  Nice service.  The pulled pork had a weird taste.  That is my only complaint.  the onion rings were hot and crisp.  The fries were also hot.  The yet of the meals were ok.  The price was a little high.  We had 6 appetizers, 1/2 price, and 3 drinks, 1/2 price as well, Happy Hour.  The bill was $55.00.  At full price would have been over $100.00.  There was not a meal.  So overall ok food, but the price is little high.

I had a voucher for $25 for Darden Restaurants and from the choices available, I opted to try Bahama Breeze.

I arrived about 5:15 and was seated in a rather empty restaurant except for a private party in one room.  I was seated immediately and my server, Mike, came over and ask for drink order and let me know if I had any questions about the menu to ask.  He got my iced tea.

I ordered a cup of black bean soup and the coconut shrimp.  The bean soup was brought in a short time drizzled with a back and forth with a cilantro-crema.  The crema didn't really give the soup any flavor.  It seems it was more decorative than functional. 

The main course--coconut shrimp--was brought with the correct amount of break between appetizer and main.  The shrimp were good and it had been quite awhile since I had coconut shrimp which I like.  It was served broccoli and yellow rice.  The shrimp were good but I think it would be better as an appetizer than a main.  

For dessert, I got the chocolate island, a dessert the menu describes as "rich chocolate mousse on a fudge brownie island in chocolate sauce and vanilla bean anglaise."  It was a very good dessert and the best part of the meal.

Mike's service was very good.  My iced tea was refilled without asking.

Bahama Breeze was an OK place.

First time at one of these chains. the atmosphere was cool the service was great the Drinks Alone deserve the 5-star rating. We had the drink that they make in the pineapple and it was awesome! coconut shrimp was delicious as well the main courses were good too

Came here with a whole bunch of people but we sat around in different tables.  Someone on my table ordered the tower onion rings.  That was heavy, greasy, and alright.

I ordered a jerk chicken pasta which was good and had the right amount of spice.  But the grease built up quick and could be toned down some.  I was able to try my friends chicken breast and I liked the mango salsa that came with it.  So far we have:

Appetizers:  Onion Rings (3/5).
Entrees:  Jerk Chicken Pasta (3/5) and Grilled Chicken Breast (4/5).  

But the best was yet to come!  I ordered a chocolate mousse dessert, the chocolate island.  It was made with a perfectly baked brownie!  Taadaa... Dessert:  Chocolate Island.(6/5). 

Service was alright, the restaurant was busy and the fan above our table wasn't working.  -.-  I didn't really feel the Bahama vibe but it could also be because I didn't order anything that that could be found outside Bahama Breeze.  There is that cool firepit thing to the left of the restaurant when you first walk in, i want to sit there next time!

Haven't really been to Bahama Breeze in years....but thanks to a Red Lobster gift card (both restaurants belong to Darden), and a Valentine's date for some KISS Mini Golf (review on that later), we were hungry!

Got to say, restaurant is still not bad for a Caribbean-themed chain.  Place was hoppin'!  Very, very busy.  Folks must like their congo music, eh?  Breezy.  Luckily even with no reservations our wait time for a table was less than five minutes.  Like the place - open, airy, noisy, and boy do I love the smell of Jerk chicken on the grills.  I'm really hoping that it's cooked on an open charcoal flame, but I'm pretty sure it's probably not.  Can't have everything I suppose.

After getting seated and giving our drink order (Bahama Breeze using bottles of Republic of Tea - Ginger Peach is tasty but a tad pricy) we were ready to view the menu.  It really is a bit of a mix, some Jamaican, some Caribbean, some American.  Fortunately a lot of it sounded tasty.

Wifey couldn't decide so she settled on the Island Hopper ($19.99) - appetizer sampler platter of sorts that included their signature Jamaican chicken wings, crispy coconut shrimp, onion rings, and conch fritters.  It came with sauce sides of jerk BBQ sauce, citrus mustard, and a roasted pineapple chutney.  For the most part she enjoyed it.  The Jamaican chicken wings were a bit smaller than she remembered but they were still very tasty with a peppery kick.  Coconut shrimp were indeed crispy, but light, with good hints of sweet when dipped in the pineapple chutney.  Conch fritters were only OK, a bit forgetful because they tasted more of a hush puppy with very little conch inside.  And the onion rings, well they were just onion rings.

I ended up getting the Cuban Sandwich ($10.99) and while I did like it, I should have read the menu better.  Why does Bahama Breeze put lettuce & tomato in a Cuban sandwich??  And salami???  Very, very strange.  Just do it like the Cubans guys - marinated roasted pork, good ham, Swiss cheese, pickles, and mustard between buttered Cuban bread then smooshed in a plancha till golden brown.  Simple!  Thank you Jon Favreau of Iron Man and Chef fame!  I think I would have enjoyed this sandwich a lot more without the extra fluff, but did applaud the effort of Bahama Breeze trying to make the sandwich their own.  Next time I would just order it with no lettuce & tomato, or just put it on the side.

Overall a good experience at Bahama Breeze, the atmosphere was inviting, and the service was stellar without being pretentious.  The food could use some tweaking but that's par for the course.  If this place wasn't so far from where we live I would be likely to check out their menu further or at least come down for their hoppin' Happy Hour.

Jamaican me crazy!

I came here with my family over Thanksgiving holiday for lunch.  We were getting sick of buffets so decided to try something different.  Food is average.  We ordered the wings (big size!), lobster quesadillas with side of seafood chowder, coconut shrimp with side of chicken tortilla soup and portabello mushroom burger.  Only items that stood out were the seafood chowder and wings.  Burger was not very good, something about all the ingredients and manchego cheese just did not work well together.  Their signature lemonade with cane sugar is very good.  Overall, the ambiance is cute and tropical inside.  Nice getaway from the Vegas crowds!!

Great, beautiful, and perfect priced! I do reccomend the Jerk Shrimp Appetizer and the Banana nut covered in brandy sauce for dessert.. So delicious  The service here is very calm and assertive to your need and delivers well. Sunday through Thursday they have happy hour after 9 til close and all appetizers are half off great deal!! Come and try it yourself #jerksauce is good on everything
Came here with my girlfriend and enjoyed every minute of it. Food was great not to mention the service.

I've lived here a year and never been to this place.  It's been on my radar

It was great.  Good food good drinks.  We sat on the patio and had a great lunch 

KAT the manager came and talked to us and was so friendly.    Ryan are server was great. Super nice 

Only complaint would be to have to pay $1.50 for the bread with my pasta.  I've never seen that anywhere ever

Had a great meal at Bahama Breeze while In Vegas. We had such a great time. But it was mostly due to the great team of Jarrod and Raven. They were the best servers EVER!! 

We got there just in time for a GREAT happy hour. We all ordered the pineapple coconut martini. It was the best!! And then got 2 orders of the best coconut shrimp I have ever had. Loved the crunch and the coconut was cooked perfect. The dipping sauce made it taste even better. 

We then ordered a bunch of apps and they were all delish too. We also ordered the coconut mojitos. It was like a dessert. Sooooo good. 

But our servers Jarrod and Raven made our night even better. They took such great care of us!! They were just amazing. They really know their stuff. 

I just wish Bahama Breeze was in California. I have to come all the way to Las Vegas to eat there.

Tried this spot out this week and was pretty good except the steak didnt have any flavor but the jerk wings were good the firecracker shrimp was good .. would come back again to try some other stuff here lots of selections on the menu

3 stars for the fire cracker shrimps and customer service. But the Calypso shrimp linguine is absolutely disgusting, also do not order steak from this place. No seasoning and just wasn't good quality steak.

I go to Bahama Breeze in Seattle & Vegas.  Love this  place.  Great atmosphere. Food, drinks & service are always right on point.  Tonight I had the jerk chicken sliders, jerk chicken pasta and key lime pie for dessert. Highly recommend.
Just average nothing to write home about. Very expensive average food. Onion rings ok. I had a steak just average.

Well, well, well, Bahama Breeze. I thought that I would be able to go to this establishment with some close friends to enjoy a nice dinner. Our experience tonight has truly made us never want to go to this business again. I suggest that anyone that reads this takes this information to heart. My friend had to use the bathroom and he has Parkinsons so he cannot use the bathroom on his own and needed my help. To put this as clean as possibly I was directing his stream in the bathroom when a worker walked in. He made some rude, sarcastic comment to us and walked out. I was shocked. I thought that this harassment would be over but when we returned to our tables the owner came to our table to talk to us. We did not want to scare our dates off so we just apologized but the owner accused us of peeing on the wall. He told us that it was a family friendly establishment and it wouldn't be tolerated. Now this is 2017. I don't understand why people still cannot accept someone for who they are. It has been scientifically proven that the hypothalamus lights up for certain interactions and that it lights up in a different way for one's sexual preference. They cannot change the way they are. The owner refused to believe our story and its sad that he harassed my friend due to his disability. If you have any respect for the people on this earth then please do not come to this business. They are extremely homophobic and provided a miserable experience. The food was not even that good and not worth the prices that they were. Pathetic.

I love this place..we come here everytime we go to vegas..jamaician wings are delicious..there my favthing on the menu..crispy and full of flavor!I tried the butermilk fried chicken sliders....they were good....husband had a salmon pasta that he loved..lots of salmon in it.alcohol drinks are great too..all of them! Enjoy!

Ok , this review is just for their happy hour, which is probably one of the cheapest and best in town !!   3$ large draft beers and half off selected appetizers , hell yeah !! They also have 4$ and 5$ cocktails using decent brands as well , and happy hour is available anywhere in the restaurant, which is great for people with children!!  Some happy hour highlights are the spinach dip , a large bowl of gooey goodness served with warm chips , also their wings are amazing no matter which you choose ( the Jamaican jerk , tho are an acquired taste ) and the large portion of coconut battered onion rings are crispy and delicious ! So check them out !!

I like Bahama Breeze for something a little different.  It is part of the Darden family of restaurants (Olive Garden, Red Lobster, Long Horn Steakhouse) but this is neither Italian, seafood or steak.  Sure, they have pasta, fish and beef but that is not what they're about. 

Bahama Breeze is about the feel of the Caribbean.  The place looks like a beach resort that one may find in, say, the Bahamas. There are palm trees, torches, fruity cocktails and an overall laid back atmosphere.  The menu is substantial and has something for just about anybody.  It is a restaurant/menu I have been enjoying for over 10 years.  

I started coming here with my office for a holiday party.  Then we came back for a retirement party.  And again for a going away party.  Maybe even two.  I've come in with family a couple of times now also.  Each time I stop in I try somthing different.  Coconut shrimp (amazing and unfortunately not an option for me any more), chicken skewers and rice (not on the menu any more), West Indies curry rice bowl, jerk chicken pasta, buttermilk fried chicken with mashed potatoes.  I've tried the black bean soup.  I've tried a salad.  I've never been disappointed with anything I've had here.

I've had some of the drinks too.  A sample of the coconut mojito which was good but very sweet.  A taste of the watermelon jalepeno margarita.  A zombie (which I seem to remember liking very much).  I did have an off pint of Guiness once.  Not sure what happened to that keg but it wasn't good.  However, I've also had a Newcastle here and it was spot on.  

Service has always been consistent and pleasent.  Even coming in on Mother's Day with a 7:00 PM reservation went off without a hitch.  We were seated just before our scheduled time and were waited on equally quick.  Having taken the time to look at the drinks and food, we ordered and just got to talking.  Before we knew it we had all that we had ordered and the meal had begun.  We were out of there by 8:15.  Not bad considering how busy this place was on a holiday.

Okay, I came back again to give this place a second chance and since I'm staying in a hotel across the parking lot for two weeks.  Plus all the other restaurants nearby were pretty crowded.  This time I sat at the bar, thinking I would actually get served this time.  And I did.  It was okay.  The food was alright and the happy hour prices I lucked into were awesome.  However, I was forced to sit on the side of the bar nearest the kitchen giving me great insight to this place and after sitting here for an hour I just can't help, but feel like I'm on the set of "Waiting" the movie.

We were visiting Las Vegas for relaxation... Wanted to try different restaurants and some food and drinks we don't get often where we live. My husband loves coconut shrimp, so I looked up restaurants that served them. There was  Bahama Breeze and Kahunaville, (which is in T.I.) I made reservations with Kahunaville for later in the week,... (which we HATED)... but went to the early happy hour at Bahama Breeze.(they even have two happy hour times, early and late) Kahunaville, ended up being one HUGE MESS of noise, and the food was mediocre and expensive,( I reckon because it being on the strip). 
  But back to Bahama Breeze. The place was great! It is in a mall of restaurants and parking was a ..."breeze"...(get it?)... It had the atmosphere with the truly tropical feel of  shutters, lanais, wood,  bamboo, gardens, fire pits, open and airy. Man, even the men's restroom was great! 
  The happy hour menu was fantastic! $3.00 & $4.00 drinks, and 1/2 off appetizers! Our server was Sam, and she was great, fast and efficient.
We had the beef empanadas: nice and spicy, with a nice fruity salsa, the warm goat cheese dip with flatbread crisps: GREAT! The cheese comes in warm bell peppers. The coconut shrimp: you get 6 fairly large perfectly seasoned shrimp with a spicy mustard sauce... in fact my husband ordered two of them... The tropical drinks we ordered were far more superior and tasty than Kahunaville... and a lot less expensive! 
  Over all Bahama Breeze got our vote for BEST "Island food and drink" in Las Vegas.
In the words of a past Governor of CA, " I'll be back!" I want to try it all!
great happy hour specials, this place makes you forget about the desert

Ok I get the customer is king thing but this was over the top...the waiter was at the table so much that we couldn't  hold a conversation fish tacos were good lunch special was a great value I ordered Mt Gay and coke...and received coke only... I don't think he knows the brands of rum.Lol...but all around fun place good food...affordable...sorry not picture worthy lmao

A return to Vegas is not complete without a visit to Bahama Breeze, one of our all time favorite restaurants along with Lee's Roadside Grill in St. Maarten in the Caribbean. 

Last night we had:

Jamaican Jerk Chicken marinated with authentic jerk seasonings and then roasted, served with yellow rice, black beans and ripe plantations.

Chipotle Beef Bowl 

Seafood Paella 
With sauteed scallops, shrimp, fish, mussels,  chicken and chorizo sausage with yellow rice.

Add live music and its a fantastic atmosphere and dinner.

http://m.bahamabreeze.com/locations/nv/las-vegas/las-vegas/3020?cmpid=br:bb_ag:ie_ch:dry_ca:BBGMB_dt:ong_sn:gmb_gt:las-vegas-nv-3020_pl:locurl_rd:1020

http://www.leesfish.com/index.html

Bahama Breeze is amazing for happy hour! The prices are so cheap for both drinks and appetizers. They don't just have happy hour on crappy drinks no one wants, you'll definitely want these drinks! I The appetizers are delicious as well, for a good price. Customer service is also great.

I had a great time. I ordered the paella and it's delicious even though I know I make it great if not better at home. The beef empanadas was slightly greasy but still yummy. The shrimp and crab with the toasted bread was above mediocre. The coconut shrimp was amazing and so was their fried shrimp. The baby back ribs was falling off the bone tender and my 3 year old ate one after another. The jerk chicken taste way better than it looks. The nachos were a classic fave. I know you are reading this and must be like wow this girl eats a lot but FYI I'm pregnant so I have a big appetite. The singer played and sang me Happy Birthday and he sings great music. The waitresses were on point, friendly, and nice. The only thing that could've made this experience better was if my husband was there but I understand he had to work. Someone has to make money but I definitely would go here again and my sister loved it so much she wants to come here on her Birthday. Oh and last but not least the mango beach drink is to die for! Best drink I ever had(non alcoholic)

I do love Bahama Breeze even if it is a bit of a walk from the Main Strip, Its a Caribbean Style Restaurant which just looks like you've stepped into the Caribbean in Las Vegas, All the staff are really friendly and willing to help, We went on a Sunday evening when it was happy hour 9pm until close they also have it Monday through till Friday from 4pm-6pm and Sunday through to Thursday 9pm until close, I had a 20z Beer in an iced cold glass for $3!!!! They have a great selection of beers and cocktails in the happy hour! No wonder this place was soooo busy! They also have a great selection of appetisers half price so we choose the massive Crispy Onion rings! they were huge and so tasty!!! For the mains i had the Jerk Chicken pasta which was good!!! And my partner had the one of the Burgers which was also huge! The portions here are not small so come on a empty stomachl!! The whole place was buzzing and had a great feel to the place and it was nice to escape from the Strip for a while, They also have live entertainment on some nights including some great Reggae and Caribbean tunes so you can just pretend youre in the Caribbean. If youre planning on taking a visit here  from the Strip i would recommend taking a taxi as it is a bit of a walk and the area can be a little sketchy.

I love steak so I'm always looking to try some new flavor to my steak, the sirloin I had at bahama was good and cooked true to order (I prefer my steak medium, and it was). The shrimp salsa was also quite delicious :)
Good food, slow service.  The ribs were not as good as the 1st time we were here. After the food was served the wait staff was more attentive.  The store was pretty empty for a Friday night.

This is not the first time I visit the Bahama Breeze. A very good casual restaurant with decent food and good service. This time, I actually get to write a review and it is quite a pleasant one. Ordered a Cubano sandwich that came with fries and lots of ham and sauces that the sandwich had. A very substantial portion, by the way. Will definitely bring more people to this place as it does deliver the Bahama Breeze experience.

what a great place!  it has everything...tropical atmosphere, reasonable prices, fantastic menu with super good food.  nice selection of exotic tropical cocktails. we tried hard to find a blemish during our visit, and found ourselves planning our next repeat visit to try other menu items. it was like being back in Key West again.
The breeze is cool. Not too fancy. The drinks are a little watery but the grub is decent.

I came in here the other night because I wanted to try Caribbean food for the first time. I was lost looking at the menu because everything looked so good. Tamikah was my server and seemed to know exactly what I was looking for. She suggested the key West nachos and I swear she read my mind. Then she told me it was happy hour and that the food was discounted so I decided to get a drink she suggested an ultimate piña colada I thought it was too girly but she insisted it would be great. I ordered it and it was so strong very good. I was so happy with her passion and knowledge of the food and restaurant in general. This girl deserves and award with the way she treated me and my family. I will be a regular here from now on. Thank you tamikah for a great experience.

Aww SNAP, go visit LUIS at the outside bar.  

Yep, that's how I'm starting this review.  So, me and some friends were looking to have a GREAT margarita since it was Cinco De Mayo (you know being in the spirit of the 'holiday'.  We found ourselves at Bahama Breeze, to to grab a drink or two and listen to the band.  I'm glad we went, it's always the nights that are NOT planned that you have the MOST fun.

We seat ourselves at the outside bar, there was an island band playing that night.  FYI: There's a live band every Friday...ok, so at the bar get the menu and see that they have a special for the night $5 Margaritas (Mango, Classic, Strawberry and 2 other flavors).  6 Margaritas and a chicken quesadilla later we were SAUCED and that's when the night got live.  The band was cool, it was a Caribbean themed band that week.  

This review is not about the food or the band, even though BOTH were great, this review is about the BARTENDER LUIS @ the outside.  Out of this world customer service, he was definitely in charge of his bar that night.  Not only assisting in making the drinks for the servers, he still maintained a great quality of service that he provided to us at the bar.  Very attentive to all, even took a moment to crack a joke or two with the folks at the bar.  I LOVE service like this, it makes me come back on the regular.  I will definitely be back soon, no need to wait for the hostess to seat, I walking straight to the outside bar to go hang with LUIS!

Go visit him, he's really cool.  I promise this is not personal review, I did not know Luis until last week.  Good thing I was looking for a great margarita because I found one and it was accompanied by an AWESOME person/bartender.

This is my go to spot for Happy Hour! Great drinks and appetizers with friends that will not break you if you are budgeting. The server and bartenders are fun as well. A lot of my friend who come to visit are jealous because many of the Bahama Breezes don't have this type of happy hour or has closed. I also love the burger for lunchtime. Nice and juicy.

Daytime Happy Hour is Monday - Thursday, 4pm-6pm
Late Night Happy Hour is Sunday - Thursday 9pm-Close

Me & 3 other friends come to celebrate one of my friend's birthday. We order their nachos, shrimp (scampy like) in lite dishes, coconut shrimp plate, jerk chicken. The plate comes with rice, black beans & fried banana. Sit Inside more quite than cover patio (they have live music), next time I like to sit inside because outside by cover patio to much fan at the ceilling and make my food get cold faster. We all like our food
We got fun server but  I forgot his name.

Thanks to yelpers we had a very good experience at this funky place.  I was sold on the mixed drink pics (didn't have one).  
I did have the most delicious black bean soup (Cuban style) and so tasty.  
I also had the lobster and shrimp quesadilla which was very good.  I did share and every one said it was their fave.  
The service was excellent and the
Bathrooms were very cute ... 
I would love to return here.  Good food good service and cute atmosphere... winning combo

I love this restaurant- so much that I had my bachelorette party there. I love the atmosphere (the decor is tropical), the food is excellent, and the caribbean music (free entertainment) adds to the overall fun feel of this restaurant. It's easy to feel good in this type of restaurant. I've only been here for dinner, but about ten times. (Twice for an e-mail member event- that was fun!) The service is really good. The location (Paradise/Flamingo) is in "Restaurant Row." It's very easy to get there from the Strip, if you are just visiting. If you're coming for dinner, make a reservation, because this is a very popular restaurant. Outside seating is nice, if you can stand the heat during the summer months.  

My favorite appetizer is the Coconut Shrimp. It's now the best all around in Las Vegas, since Red Lobster's version has changed. I don't like a whole lot of breading- like how they do so often at chinese restaurants. It's definitely not the case here. Also, the size of the shrimp is pretty good.  

My favorite dish here is the Caribbean Jerk Chicken Pasta. I am not usually a fan of creamy sauces, but I make the exception here. It is the perfect blend of bowtie pasta, jerk chicken (love that spice combination), mushrooms, and asparagus. It's the best thing on the menu. But that's my opinion. I've tried other things on the menu but I keep coming back to this dish. 

About the prices, it's a chain restaurant, so the prices are going to be slightly higher than some restaurants out there. Frankly, I didn't think that the Planet Hollywood restaurants are anything special, but they still remain popular today for some reason. I would rather go to Hard Rock Cafe, but now, my husband doesn't think those restaurants are anything special either.        

SInce I love this place, I am sure we will be back again.

Food: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Cleanliness: 5/5
Decor & Style: 5/5

I love this environment. Great bahama drinks, great food, great live music! They use to have one in Oklahoma City but it closed down. Now the only time I can enjoy it is when I visit Vegas! Service was slightly slow, but the bartender was pretty good when we sat at the bar.

Never been here before, but I had a gift certificate. My daughter & I came. We started out with ultimate pineapple drink. Yum!! Ordered spinach dip. Super yummy.  Then dinner. We both ordered the tenderloin pork with sweet potatoes. It came and my daughter is allergic to mango. We thought we read it carefully. It said nothing about the pineapple salsa, which had mango.  Our server (Travis) was awesome he took it away & made her a new one without salsa. Will definitely look for another Bahama Breeze near us. Great job.

I ordered a dish a specific way, which came out incorrect the first time. The second time the dish wasn't cooked all the way, which I had sent back. Before the dish was brought out correctly the manager came over (with a slight attitude) to ask what the problem was, and after he explained he pretty much made excuses and admitted that certain foods weren't made fresh and authentic to any Caribbean way. The whole conversation was unnecessary for him to come over defensive, I didn't ask for any dishes to be compt just made right. 

I will drink at bahama breeze occasionally and eat light appetizers, but not certain dishes.

I really had very high expectations for this place when I first found out we were attending a wedding reception dinner here. I have had great authentic food on the islands so I was excited about Bahama Breeze ( island grille ). Well I would like to say it is more like an American breeze with a Bahama inspiration. But after getting over the fact there is really no authentic food here this place is pretty good. We had a party of around 30 and were seated privately in a covered patio section of restaurant. This place is huge, nice and spacious. Seemed like everyone really enjoyed their drinks, I had the Bahamarita and it was very good. Ok so menu items we tried were beef empanadas: their version is good and the sauces that came with were very good. Coconut shrimp: I have had better but it was good, the sauce to dip was the winner. BBQ ribs: very good like rib joint good, Seafood and jerk pasta I was told was excellent, plenty of shrimp and lobster. The portions here are pretty big too, most guests had to go bags. I found out after the fact from a local that the one authentic item they had was conch fritters, man one of my favorites so can't wait to try them.  Our great, very patient, and very nice waitress Christine informed us about their happy hour, so we will be back since we visit Vegas frequently.

Omg this place is awesome. Food was great and super fresh and the service was amazing! The bahamarita was out (when we wanted our second round) and they were super quick to comp our second round of something else! Everything is clean and well spaced out.
Food was very good. I checked out the drink menu and was amazed at how many cocktails they have. I was still recovering from the night before of drinking, so I did not order a drink.
A favorite of mine. Bahamarita martini is a must and signature drink. It's refreshing with their coconut shrimp pasta. Customer service is always friendly.
Love, love, loved this place. 6 happy hour appetizers down the gullet loved. Nice atmosphere, we had great service. I will definitely be back

VERY GOOD. I had the jerk shrimp appetizer with the cuban bread and LOVED it. The service was ok, but then again, we had a party of 23 and I dont think they were very well prepared for that. The reason I'm giving 5 stars is because the food was SOOOO good. and the conch frittters; TO DIE FOR.

I had the very bland fish tacos and my husband had the fried chicken. The service was friendly but the food is was very disappointing, because it didn't have much favor. We asked our server for various sauces trying to add taste to our meal but it didn't improve much. We won't be back.

This place was very tasty! Dinner and drinks with my mom. Mom was little hesitant at first but they offer a lot on the menu, and our waiter was from Burbank Ca, which I forget his name but he was awesome and very helpful in helping choose dinner. Thank you for good food, good drinks, and  great experience
I loved this place. We've come here many times. Great menu and amazing service. Bahama Breeze has the best pina coladas and mojitos. I highly recommend a visit to this place.

First time here and it was a great experience. Hostess was able to seat us quickly on Friday night. Service was quick and delightful. Everything we ate was good. Drinks were tasted good. At the end of the night I thought it was a pretty good deal.

The place really took care of my gluten and dairy intolerances. Service is just excellent. Great ambience for a cozy dinner. Not a crowded place but close to the strip. Good selection of drinks, I got high with just one of their strawberry mojitos. Huge quantities of food too.

Located on Flamingo Blvd, just east of the Las Vegas Strip. Ok so it's a chain, I have no problem with that. This is a great place to take visiting family if you want to avoid the strip. The service is great, the prices good, and food is fun. Oh and they have a great selection of drinks as well. What else do you need? Nothing you say? Good, then stop on by. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

Came here on a weekday for an escape and catch up with my uncle and was very pleasantly surprised. I'd been to a Bahama Breeze near Seattle a couple years ago and it screamed chain. So did this one upon first inspection, but a few things stood out.

First, our waiter was top notch. Friendly, engaging, knowledgeable, and even engaged us as we asked about how the local dining businesses were faring in the current economic state. He was actually a PT waiter at another restaurant, and he helped us pick our dishes.

The food was surprisingly tasty. I had the jerk chicken bowtie pasta, which was slightly spicy but in a good way.

Although I might not go actively searching for this place next time I am in Vegas, I would recommend it if you're looking for a reasonably priced, tasty meal.

Work dinners - you want to go somewhere affordable, has something that everyone would like, and have okay food. That's how I feel about Bahama Breeze. Affordable and OK.

Our server was fantastic - bright and bubbly, recommended a handful of items. It took us about 20+ minutes to get ready and order, yet she checked on us ever 5 minutes to answer questions.

I personally got the Jerk Chicken, with cinnamon sweet potatoes, green beans and a mango pineapple salsa. I didn't taste much of the jerk seasonings - but then again, the menu DID say "mild". The sweet potatoes very very sweet, but it balanced with the salsa and chicken.

One of my co-worker's dish was forgotten by the food runner, so our server came by and said the manager comped the dish and a hot plate would be coming right up. Good service!

Happy hour is throughout the whole resturant and every appetizer we ordered was better than the last! We had so many we didnt make it to the dinner!  The empanadas and crab stack were amazing loved this place and will  be coming back again tomorrow!.
Ask for layer pina calada 5/5* eating with coconut shrimps  5/5* and watching final FIFA world cup. Nothing else us better than this!! Germany vs Argentina 1-0.. Goal.....
I find the food to be simply overrated. Service is okay. The table was sticky. This would be my first and last time to eat at this place.

For anyone who takes the time to read my reviews, you know I'm critical and somewhat unforgiving.  That being said,  Bahama Breeze knocked my socks off. We started with the beef empanadas, then I ordered the chipotle beef bowl and hubster ordered ribs with garlic mashed taters.  The app was flavorful and so delicious. I had agreed to get the full order beef bowl to share, but, after I tasted it,  I wanted to protect it like the last package of Twinkies in a zombie apocalypse. Hubby loved on his ribs while I shielded my bowl from his wandering fork.  There's no room for dessert, but, my flashy green drink was good,  too. Our waiter was attentive and the water was flowing. Thank you,  BB, this meal was such a pleasant, last minute surprise.   Mwah!  Hugs and kisses....till we meet again.

Somehow being in a Caribbean themed restaurant in Las Vegas just didn't feel so out of place as the entire town is full of make-believes.

On a whim, a colleague loved this place so introduced this restaurant to us so we came here and tried several dishes. The place felt lively, yet relaxing. I particularly liked my virgin ultimate pineapple drink -  essentially piña colada and strawberry ice in a freshly cut pineapple without the alcohol. It's so refreshing & satisfying! The Jamaican chicken was just okay and the portion was plentiful.  the waiter was friendly and everyone seemed to enjoy the atmosphere and conversations.

Another reason to dine here is that it's pretty close to the strip, has plenty of parking and easy to hail a cab or get rideshare to and fro.

I would definitely return if in a mood of something different and tropical in Vegas.

Good food - service could be a little bit better - but they have great food! 
I had the Shrimp, avocado and crab tower and it was delicious! 
Nice place in Vegas that is off the strip and a nice place to eat when in town for business purposes...

Great food and great service.  Always a pleasure to eat here.  Staff are very friendly and quick on service. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.  Me and my wife have been here several times and we have not been disappointed once. If you get a chance sit at the bar and ask for Doug he is very knowledgeable, fun, and can tell he really enjoys helping the customer with making decisions on food and drinks.  I must say every time we have come in and he is here Doug hasn't let us down with his recommendations so kudos to him. Great place keep up the great work!!!

i havent had bahama breeze in like 6 years, but my fiances cousin had her wedding reception there and their food was definetly better than the last time i had it. the DRINKS too. delicious!!! I had a jerk chciken pasta which was bomb i also had a strawberry margarita and a flight but cant remebr the names of the drinks, but they all were good and there was no holding back on the alcohol. the waiters and waitresses that served us were really polite and attending so thank you all for a good time and good food.

Love this place off The strip. Fab happy hour on weekdays from 9 to closing with half Price delicious appetizers ( Coconut shrimp and onion rings favorites but all was good) bbq baby ribs also a good choice to share ( large portions). Cocktails hit The spot at 3-4$ happy hour. Been a few years back and came back twice this time.

food is ok.
Specialty drinks are better.
The best coconut shrimp wish the had one in Ca. The place is big the service is great. When I'm in Vegas this is where I eat.

Last month was my first time checking out their happy hour. & let me just say.. amazing!! Great prices on great drinks and food. Bahamaritas are my favorite. A must try! The sangria was ok.. not the best, but hey I drank it anyway. I also got a Blue Moon which I love. As far as food goes, we ordered most of the happy hour menu. Lots of food! The only reason I'm giving them four stars is because the service was pretty slow. It took foreeeever to get the check and then even longer to pay. But overall, very nice happy hour experience. I've been many times not during happy hour and I always get the jerk chicken pasta. It's soooo good!

Good location away from the middle of the strip. Ample parking. Went with a large group and was seated in the outside patio. Had a fire going and there was live music. The atmosphere was very nice. 

The waiter took our drink order right away. Great selection of fancy drinks. 

I had the Coconut Shrimp with extra broc instead of the rice. The Coconut Shrimp was outstanding. It came with 7 very large Shrimp and I could not eat them all.  Would be plenty large to split with someone else. It came with a salad that was good but nothing special. 

The rest of my table had the Chicken that was served with mashed potatoes and corn. They all said it was very good. The serving was enormous and easily could be shared. 

Overall a very good experience. I would eat here again. The atmosphere is casual, the service is good and efficient and the food was tasty.

Great for a laid back Sunday afternoon lunch!  The staff was friendly,  the food arrived quickly and hot. The atmosphere was great,  chill for an afternoon margita (Sunday,  1pm) with no waiting for seating.  Our Waiter was Gerald,  I think.  He had some good suggestions and a great attitude.  Lunch special was good (Mahi mahi).  I suggest adding the $2.5 side salad,  a great value.  Margarita was a little on the sour side (many near the strip have been to me) not too weak though : ).  Will keep this place on the laid back weekend afternoon selection.
I've been coming here on and off for over two years and the food has retained its quality as well as the professionalism of staff. The food is still great and I'll be back again and again.

Management sucks! Manager placed me on hold for over 15 minutes. Never ever going here and I will never recommend it. 
2 thumbs DOWN!
Every time we come to Vegas, we come...  Delicious Food... Great service and the cocktail's very creative ;)))))

Great place if your ready to get off the strip, reasonable prices and the service is top notch, the atmosphere is great. Our server Josh was superb, full of fun and knowledge about the menu. Would highly recommend

Went here for a company Christmas party, so I understand the service and food might not be as it would for say 2-4 people... With that said....

Appetizers were cheap: Chicken quesadilla was just bland, edaname was good but c'mon. Fun, but cheap.
Same thing goes for the meals. I had the fish tacos, TERRIBLY FISHY. I'm a HUGE fan of Wahoo's, so this was such a disappointment. My husband had the cuban, I had a bite of it and the bread was grilled and pressed, but tasted so dried out.

The drinks were amazing though, for that it gets 2 stars. =o)

Tina and the assistant manager were awesome! They took care of my gluten free diet and served a tasty  meal. Tina was very attentive, personable and just so much fun! She even brought a bag of ice for our friend's knee. Our guests loved their meals and cocktails too. Even though BB is a chain restaurant, this place rocks!

I love place! The first time was many years ago, where I had seafood paella for the very first time. I think that dish made this restaurant memorable, plus the island decor. I think I had a mojito, which was strong, and I couldn't finish it. I don't go to Las Vegas very often, but when I do, this place was always in the back of my mind, and I do get a little sad when we don't get to go eat there. Service had been great for the times we went. We even brought kids with us one time, and they enjoyed the food. I'll be waiting for the next trip to Sin City, and soon so I can use the coupon they sent me by email.

After a late show on the Strip we headed over to Bahama Breeze for an even later Happy Hour.  Happy is the key word:  I was happy that they're open till midnight, happy at the extensive food menu available, and happiest at the triple-flavor Frozen Bahamarita available for 4 bucks.

Having been to a Yelp event at the one in Princeton, NJ, I was pretty familiar with the menu choices.  But I hadn't tried the tostones with chicken, which our waiter recommended.  And I wasn't disappointed.  The large, thick plaintain slices were covered with an impressive amount of chicken, cheese, and other goodies.  Think nachos on speed.

My husband, the non-seafood-eater, let me talk him into the Lobster and Shrimp quesadilla, which came with pico de gallo, sour cream and, I think, guacamole (though that may have been with the tostones.  One Bahamarita is all it takes for me!).

Service was great, the food was delicious, and paying half price was the best of all.

We were starving when we left the Atomic Testing Museum. I suggested Bahama Breeze because it was conveniently close and their Coconut shrimp was beckoning me! I also love their dessert drinks. 

I feel like I'm on a mini vacation when I come in here. Maybe it's the Banana Strawberry Daiquiri that puts me in the mood. The sips I took were fantastic ! My husband didn't like his Sangria (they don't serve it with fruit in the glass) so he drank half of my Daiquiri. My sister in law who is the "non drinker" wanted to taste it so I let her. 

 I started with the Coconut Shrimp ($9.49) for an appetizer it is big enough to be the whole meal. I just love the Citrus Mustard sauce it is served with...it's addicting! My sister in law shared her Roasted Cuban Bread ($5.99) . It had sliced vine tomatoes, basil, and Parmesan cheese. It was good ...It think it would be nice to eat with a salad. 

My main entree was the Calypso Shrimp Linguine ($13.99 lighter portion). I'm glad I ordered the lighter version because it tasted okay but it was nothing to write home about. It tasted a bit bland to and I would not order it again. 

We ended the dinner by ordering two desserts to share with the table. We had the Chocolate Island which is a chocolate mousse on a fudge brownie swimming in milk chocolate and vanilla bean anglaise. This was my favorite of the two! The second dessert was Banana Nut Supreme it has sliced bananas and vanilla ice cream topped with butterscotch brandy sauce. It tasted okay but everyone at the table liked the Chocolate Island the best! 

This is a nice place to unwind after work because they also have a Happy Hour menu!

I met a friend here during their happy hour. Very pleased with the variety of items, service was very good and the price was very reasonable. We had three appetizers and a split a nice dessert. The server was attentive and friendly. Another staffer stopped by and asked how everything was a very nice touch.

My first BB visit was down in Tampa Bay, FL, where I was impressed with the decent food items and the margaritas. So I was sure glad to find one in Vegas while roaming around for a supermarket. 

Eh, who am i kdding. Come here for the kickass margaritas, then take a taxi to the strip to party!

Literally had bugs in my salad not once but twice! They did apologize both times and were just as surprised and weirded out as I was. Let's just say the second salad I trusted them and ate half the salad then boom a bug the same kind on my fork!! Only reason for two stars is because the manager and our server were great, clearly the kitchen needs to get it together! Asap...  at your foods smh.

The manager was very accommodating.  We arrived later than our reservation but were still seated in a comfortable booth.  This is very surprising for a Friday night.  
We ordered just about every appetizer on the menu.  Hands down, the jerk chicken wings, with the perfect blend of seasoning and crispness, are the best item on the appetizer menu.  I also enjoyed the empanadas as well as the crab and shrimp stack.

Unfortunately we were too stuffed to order a dessert....maybe next time!

This place is AWESOME!! Doesn't matter what you order. 

They aren't playing around here! Happy hour on point and the drinks are strong! 

YEEEEE!! :)

Nice Find!

We just happened on this restaurant during the lunch hour while taking a walk (far off the strip near our hotel). It has a Jamaican theme to most of its dishes. I had coconut shrimp that was to die for (though only four, needed at least two more) and the house salad with the house dressing (very fancy, delicious salad). My companion had a jerk chicken sandwich and soup (can't remember what kind) he said was good. Lovely atmosphere (played island music) and nice wait staff. Lots of rum specialty drinks in the offerings, but since it was 90 degrees and we had to walk a bit, we didn't indulge. I'd go back for sure!
my husband and I come here every time we r in Vegas. delicious food. great live music. friendly and attentive staff. always a favorite place to eat.

The portions are huge! Ambience is nice and casual. 
Had a Spicy Mango Mojito minus the sugar cane juice, and it was very good and plenty sweet. 
We ordered the Firecracker Shrimp which was delish!!!!  About 15 shrimp very lightly breaded with Shiracha Mayo drizzled on top and a small bowl on the side. The mayo was so good we used it on everything after this course!  
Then we had the Jerk Chicken Pasta with a side Caesars salad and the Island Hopper appetizer as a meal. 
The pasta was loaded with asparagus and mushroom with some chicken all cooked well.  The light portion was huge, so no need for the regular portion.  
The side salad was fresh and tasty, but absolutely too big. 
The Hopper was tasty with great coconut shrimp, huge crispy jerk wings, big onion ring and conch fritters.  WAY too much food!!  Everything was good, but the 3 sauces on the platter can't hold a candle to the Shiracha mayo! 
Would definitely return here, but wait for happy hour to get 1/2 off appetizers and drinks.

So, I finally tried Bahama Breeze for the first time this past weekend  and it was "Off da Hook"!!!

My father kept telling me about this place when he's in town.  I came with my entire family (20+ members) while vacationing in Las Vegas.  They booked us a private room and the service was very helpful and friendly.

We all ordered the Bahamian Seafood Chowder (recommended by my dad and now I recommend it to you), it's a Seafood Chowder w/Fried Shrimp on top.  We also tried the Coconut Shrimp, West Indies Beef Patties (curry empanada, Simmered Jerk Shrimp (soooo gooood!!!) with a warm roll and the West Indies Ribs (huge slab and the best I ever had!)

Good food and a pretty friendly staff, but they were very aggressive about asking us over and over again if we were ready to order. We had our own server as well as another server who didn't seem t to like the pace at which we read the menu and made our choices. Good restaurant, but the service was a little too corporate and too focused on turning our table around, rather than on hosting a good meal.
I always love going here with friends for fun and yummy food and great island cocktail concoctions!

We came here on a Monday night to relax and take advantage of their happy hour special. The environment is pretty cool. We sat in the patio area where there was a live musician playing reggae classics, very enjoyable. 

I ordered the habanero wings and a classic margarita. The wings did not seem to be habanero. More of spicy BBQ sauce rather than habanero. They were actually pretty good, but calling them habanero is very misleading. For the drinks, it appears the other reviewers are correct. They are either watered down, or have barely and alcohol in them at all. My classic margarita tasted like pure lime mix. I had to order a beer instead. Be cautious of that before ordering. 

All in all, I would give this place a second try again. :)

I've literally drove past this restaurant so many times and finally had the chance to stop by. My friend was in town for her bday and wanted to hit up their late night happy hour, 9 pm to close. The specials were great.. $5 drinks and half off apps. I also loved the decor of this place. It's a bit corny, but overall tropical fun. It sort of reminded me of Margaritaville. 

As for the food my boo and I ended up sharing the fire cracker shrimp and shrimp and lobster quesadilla. Both were very tasty and especially great for such a cheap price. My favorite though was the fire cracker shrimp, it essentially was fried shrimp with a siracha Mayo dipping sauce. I'm sure it's very unhealthy, but so so good. 

Can't wait to come back here again for another happy hour. My only wish is they open another location closer to the west side of town.

I love the Jamaican jerk wings and butterfly shrimp. Happy hour is pretty much the only time I go there but it's the best time . You can sit at the bar and try a mojito, the bartenders are friendly the hostess are ok too. Will recommend!

I have been to Bahama Breeze a total of 3 visits and the food has been consistently decent. I would have given them another star but during my last 2 visits, I was completely ignored and had to flag or get up & find a waiter to request service after being seated over 15 minutes. WTH?!! This occurred in the dinning area & at the bar. Once I did get their attention, their service was attentive & on-point. 

They have a great Happy-Hour going on twice a day. Half price appetizers and beer & well drink specials. I recommend the coconut fried shrimp, the firecracker shrimp tacos, and the chicken wings. The beef empanadas are good but can be a bit heavy if you eat more than two. They have great margaritas also. Not too sweet and taste like fresh squeezed lime...very refreshing. I will continue to return. Good bar food with a "tropical" twist at decent prices. Hopefully, I will not be ignored when I sit at the bar or table next time!!!
Came here for a a last minute dinner.  The waiter was very funny and nice.

I have been here a few times and never was the biggest fan, but I will laud Bahama Breeze on my experience today: my friend Susan D. dropped her business card in while at lunch a few weeks ago and won a free happy hour party for 10 people (drinks we had to buy at happy hour prices, which is $3-$4) but it included all sorts of appetizers...and it was seemingly unlimited...for TWO HOURS!  Happy hour is 4-6 PM Monday through Friday, and there are lots of drinks but it looked like only 5 or so choices for apps.  Well, our bartender Melissa hooked it up with more than that and even though there were only 5 of us, she furnished a second round of our faves and almost ordered a third round...of FOOD...and we had to turn her down!

To drink I had the bahamarita, with strawberry, kiwi and mango slush and margarita on top with a side shot of cactus schnapps...interesting and almost like alcoholic jamba juice.  I tried a variety of apps (beef patties which were really empanadas with creole seasoning, coconut shrimp, spinach dip, chicken wings, and chicken sliders) and they also brought out cheeseburger sliders, chorizo sliders, and pulled pork sliders, none of which I tried.

My conclusion is this: 
1) a good deal for a free meal,
2) the empanadas, shrimp, and wings were good, the dip not so much, and
3) THE CAT IS OUT OF THE BAG: the chicken sliders tasted like MINI CHICK-FIL-A sandwiches!
I hardly ever eat fried food but I had 4 of these, 2 each round.  Hearty juicy fried white meat chicken, 2 pickle slices, and a tasty bun (that probably has less butter than CFA, a good thing!)

I might die tomorrow but I have to say that after being away from Chick-Fil-A for quite some time, Bahama Breeze solves that craving.  Now if only I can find good waffle fries ever since Caribbean Cooker went out of business.

Moral of this story: Go to Bahama Breeze between 4 and 6, order 1 happy hour priced chicken sliders app and 1 drink for $3 and you will thank me later.  and get Melissa as your bartender, she rocks!

5 stars for the customer service but the food just brought I  down to two.. we all go to restaurants for the food, not the workers so I have to be super honest. The food has gone downhill since the last time I've eaten here. Menu looks FABULOUS, great photos, but the food tasted freezer burn/from a box and bland. Very unexpected and disappointing. I literally lost my appetite after trying my dish, it was a rice bowl with mahi and shrimp. So NASTY! I recommend the chicken quesadilla instead, those are tasty. The environment was nice but out dated, I feel it is due for a remodel. When we sat down the dining room was very hot, I noticed many people outside on the patio but I prefer eating indoors. It seemed like they turned off the AC since customers weren't sitting inside(weird). I would give it a try again but stay inside my box and only order items that are safe and hard to ruin. The cocktails and drinks looked great.

Drinks were good. Food was overrated and over priced. I really do not understand the raving reviews regarding the shrimp and lobster quesadilla. Mediocre is being generous.
Firecracker shrimp was decent. Not sure if I will return based on the food. Outside enclosed patio area is super cute though.

I have been here twice and both times I had a good time. The atmosphere of this place really sets the mood for a laid back time. But every time I have had food her it blows. There is just nothing special about it that draws me back. To me this place is more of a place to get tootie-fruity drinks and some dip. Then it would be for an actual meal. It's almost like an upscale TGIF with bad food. 

The waiters that helped us were quite helpful and were prompt. The place is clean and I had a good time. There food is just not my thing I guess.
The food is good here. Anita is a very nice and attentive server. I would come back forsure.

I got a $50 gift card for my birthday and I haven't been to a Bahama Breeze in ages so I thought I would check this one out. Our server was very very friendly and attentive. Beef empanadas were freaking delicious. I ordered the spicy shrimp I guess it was more of an appetizer so I got a small side salad as well. Salad was very good best part was the croutons. I didn't get that much shrimp unfortunately. If you're looking for a fruity drink try the Bahamarita. Drinks were priced fairly. Dinner for two with a drink and appetizer was about $53.

Great food. Exceptional service!! I have no complaints. We were greeted warmly, sat right near the fireplace (where they seemed to be sitting all the couples) and we had two of the most lively, and nice waitresses. Service was prompt, the menu easy to read, and the portions were HUGE for the price. Loved the guitarist playing live music and it was the perfect getaway for a cold night in Vegas. I've been back twice since my first visit.

i had my wedding reception here. i purchased a food and beverage contract. the booking process was some what painless. the wait staff was very friendly. the food was pretty good. my reason for 3 stars is that it was very apparent the wait staff had been told to slow serve the adult beverages as it took many times to order a beer or glass of wine during my paid for 2 hour drink window. you could absolutely tell they were dragging their feet. piss poor tactic to try and save a buck at a girls wedding reception. shame on you.

Ms. Tina made the visit worth it.  I had shrimp and grits.  I think,  forget I know this is tge best shrimp and grits I've had.  I was pleasantly surprised!!! And did I mention my waitress Ms. Tina.  Best shrimp and grits also there's Ms. TINA.

Setting:  Tropical.  They did a good job with the decorating.  Very nice, very clean.  Nice bathrooms as well.

Food:  The food was great.  I just had an appetizer (yummy habanero wings), and it was big enough for a meal.  The food all around was tasty (tried my friends' dishes as well  :).

Service:  Very happy-go-lucky, especially the person who seated us.  An upbeat group of folks.

I rarely give 5 stars but Bahama Breeze was just perfection to me. For a chain restaurant the food was really good and our server (Steven/Stephen) was awesome. He represented the food and company very well. 

I have ate at many places on the strip and Bahama Breeze far exceeded them. 
My only suggestion/complaint is that they update their logo and the color of their restaurant. It blends too much and can easily be passed over.

we have been visiting Las Vegas for a few years now and many times have driven by this restaurant always saying "we have to come here one of these days" as it looks very inviting because of its tropical flare and never doing it. We are so glad that we did it on this visit.  we were sat out in the gazebo area which added a nice touch to the evening.  Daniel was our server who tended to us with a great smile all evening long. His recommendations were on point! My wife and I had the Jerk chicken with the bow tie pasta mushrooms and asparagus in a very delicious creamy sauce. Our daughter had the Jamaican Jerk chicken with ripe plantains rice and black beans; she was in heaven and ditch the fork in order to enjoy the chicken to the fullest. Grandma had the grilled chicken sandwich which she reported there were no extra frills so it was just good.  Somehow we managed to have enough room for dessert and are now in a very delighted sureene sugar state of being. Daniel again pointed us in the right direction and we decided to have the banana nut rum bread with caramel sauce and ice cream and the chocolate pineapple upside down lava cake, do I need to say more?   If you are ever in Las Vegas, this is a place that you can not just drive passed.

The food here is OK. Nothing adventurous or ambitious, but prepared well and there are many choices. The reason I give 5 stars is for the excellent service our party received from Tina. She is a sweetheart and a real pro. I won't eat there unless she waits on me. Sorry, she spoiled us.

Had an unexpectedly delicious meal this evening, which hubby and I thoroughly enjoyed.
I went for the Steak Oscar which came with the most amazing dressing/sauce.
Our server, Alexis, was extremely friendly and accommodating and made our experience all the better.
Great value for money.
Can't wait to return for happy hour!

Happy hour provides great specials so make sure you sign up your email to hear about upcoming events. Staff is friendly. I've not had good luck getting fresh fish (fresh?) but have enjoyed everything else.
I love this place every entree, appetizer and drink is so island tasting and amazing. A must when I'm with friends.
My favorite place to come eat in Vegas! The food is just amazing, can't go wrong with the coconut shrimp tacos. Service and ambience was great loved the classic reggae playing. Thanks guys.

I LOVE BAHAMA BREEZE!!!

Bahama Breeze has the BEST margarita's I've ever had!  Mmm, mmm, mmm!  Um, it's triple flavored and sooooooo good!!

I used to go to the Bahama Breeze in Austin, TX all the time (now shut down).  When I moved back to Cali, they didn't have one on the West Coast!  WHAAAAAAAT?  Luckily, they opened this one up in Vegas!!  Not that close to me, but only a 9hr drive or 1hr plane ride!!

Oh yes, I like the coconut shrimp too!  Not all the food items are that good, but the atmosphere is great.  Okay, the atmosphere is not-as-great at the Las Vegas location, but there is no way I can give this place less than 5-stars based on their Margarita's alone!  *yum!*

Located next to the Marriott Residence Inn. If you're a patron of the hotel, you can get 25% at this restaurant which is why I'm giving this place 4 vs. 3 stars. Cute, chill, island ambiance. Good service. Just missed the mark with the food.
Crabstack- so, the wording "premium crab" got me salivating. Sadly, both the shrimp and crab we're tasteless and you can taste that it was probably defrosted as the shrimp was a bit soft. The mango and avocado added to it was the best part. 
Stuffed plantain bowl- we requested adobo chicken instead of beef. Mixed with rice , beans, onion, peppers, mushroom, rice, etc. It had a good flavor, but we could've done without the onions and peppers.
Key lime pie- definitely tart which is why they have a thick layer of meringue on top to offset the tartness which I didn't really care for. I liked the berry and passionfruit(?) Sauces on the side to eat the pie with.

i just love the customization of seafood you can make. how you want it cooked, what sauce, what rub, what sides..it's an amazing restaurant with fantastic environment and great service. top 5 restaurant in vegas to me..along with capriottis and secret pizza at cosmo.
